You may change the type of damage you deal to strike with different parts of the blade. Whenever you attack with a longsword you may choose to have it deal piercing, bludgeoning or slashing damage instead of any other of the three types of damage (it only changes piercing, bludgeoning or slashing damage).
Regardless of armor class your armor provides, provided you are proficient with it you your minimum armor class is equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your strength modifier.

If you are wielding only one weapon in your hand and nothing in your other or are two handing your weapon, and you are proficient with that weapon, you gain +2 to your ac. (this stacks with your minimum armor defense).

subclassFeature.name: Kensei Hit Point Bonus
entries: Kensei gain an additional +1 to their hp every time they level up in this class as well as when they choose this monastic kata at level 1

subclassFeature.name: Kata Improvement
entries: You may now attack twice as a bonus action as part of your Kensei ability

subclassFeature.name: Peak Kata Improvement
entries: Your mastery of Kensei weapons grants you extraordinary accuracy. If you miss with an attack roll using a monk weapon or unarmed strike on your turn, you can reroll it. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

items: You gain proficiency with {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, {@item scimitar|phb|scimitars} and Kusari (if your DM allows them).
You gain proficiency with {@item dart|phb|darts}, {@item kunai|NICKED|kunai}, and {@item shuriken|NICKED|shuriken} (if you DM allows them)
You gain proficiency with {@item poisoner's tools}
You gain proficiency with {@skill Stealth}; double your proficiency bonus with this skill.
When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.
You may take {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Viper's Strike
entries: Once on your turn, if you have a {@item poisoner's kit} you may coat your weapon or a small bit of cloth around your fist (unarmed strike) with an oil that augments an attack. This oil is quick to dissolve so it only lasts until the start of your next turn or if it is used once. Choose Fire, Cold, Acid, Poison, Necrotic damage. That weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} of that damage type. (this ability improves at certain levels)

subclassFeature.name: Shinobi Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield your armor class equals 10 + twice your dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Kata Improvement
entries: You gain +2 to dexterity. This improvement increases your ability cap for that ability to 22.
You may now use your viper's strike twice during your turn instead of once.

subclassFeature.name: Peak Kata Improvement
entries: You now are able to exploit a creature's momentary distraction when it is hit by an attack.
Whenever a creature you can see is hit by an attack made by a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to make a weapon or unarmed attack against that creature.
Your weapon gains a use of your viper's strike whether or not you land with the attack.

items: You gain proficiency with all melee weapons with the heavy property {@filter heavy|items|property=heavy}.
You gain proficiency with {@item javelin|phb|javelins}.
You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools}
You gain proficiency with Light, Medium, and Heavy Armor
You gain proficiency with {@skill athletics} and {@skill intimidation}.
You may use your constitution modifier in place of your charisma modifier for {@skill intimidation} checks.
Your unarmed strikes count as heavy weapon attacks (as long as you have 15 strength).
You may take {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Shugoki Shove
entries: As a bonus action you may push a creature within 5 feet of you that is a size smaller than you. You push them away from you up to a distance equal to your kata movement bonus, minimum of 5ft (you may push them away less than your maximum kata movement if you choose to).
If the creature is the same size as you, you may attempt to push it in the same way by making a contested {@skill athletics} check.
You count as one size larger for the purposes of using your shugoki shove, grappling, shoving, and carry weight.

subclassFeature.name: Shugoki Minimum Armor Defense
entries: Regardless of armor class your armor provides, provided you are proficient with it you your minimum armor class is equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Shugoki Hit Point Bonus
entries: Shugoki gain an additional +2 to their hp every time they level up in this class as well as when they choose this monastic kata at level 1

subclassFeature.name: Kata Improvement
entries: When you push a creature as a bonus action with your Shugoki Shove, you deal damage to that creature equal to your Constitution Modifier.

When you take your first attack each turn with a heavy weapon, you may attack two creatures within 5 feet of each other with one attack roll. You roll once for damage. If the attack roll is high enough to hit each of the creatures deal damage to both of them, otherwise if the attack roll is high enough to hit only one of the creatures, you only hit that creature. (you use your size and large weapons to sweep and hit both of them)

subclassFeature.name: Peak Kata Improvement
entries: You gain +2 to constitution or strength (choose when you gain this ability) this improvement increases your ability cap for that ability to 22.

items: You gain proficiency with a melee weapon of you choice without the heavy property.
You gain proficiency with {@skill arcana}.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowbound Weapon
entries: Whenever you complete a short or long rest you may bind a weapon to your chakra. If you bind a new weapon in this way your old weapon appears within 5 feet of you. It also appears within 5 feet of you if you die. you can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you are incapacitated. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon that weapon, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand (no action required).

That weapon gains the thrown property with a range of 60ft/120ft. When you summon the weapon, it appears as though it is melding from your shadow or sliding out of a sleeve or pocket, it can also manifest itself in a different way out of sight if you so choose.

When you throw the weapon, you can mentally command it to simply leap from your hand and fly at your target. You can attack this way even if you are restrained, but you must be able to see your target.

Your weapon uses your intelligence modifier for all attack rolls and for damage. Your weapon appears to be a shadow apparition of the weapon you bind with your chakra. A creature can trace your chakra back to you from the weapon with a successful {@skill Investigation} check (the chakra trails back to you for the next 6 seconds) DC= 8 + your proficiency bonus + your intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Defense
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield your armor class equals 10 + Dexterity modifier + your intelligence modifier. Your body is wreathed in a light shadow energy that is barely discernible to the eye.

subclassFeature.name: Kyoshin Hit Point Bonus
entries: Kyoshin gain an additional +1 to their hp every time they level up in this class as well as when they choose this monastic kata at level 1

subclassFeature.name: Kata Improvement
entries: You gain +2 to hit on all your thrown weapon attacks, you may now fling your weapons with a range of 120/180. You gain 4 more maximum chakra points.

subclassFeature.name: Peak Kata Improvement
entries: You gain the ability to set up lethal shadow blades in someone's body.

When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or your shadow bound weapon, you can spend 4 chakra points to cause these shadow blades to slice, which lasts for a number of days equal to your monk level.

The shadow blades are harmless and undetectable unless you use your action to end them. To do so, you and the target must be on the same plane of existence. When you use this action, the creature must make a constitution saving throw. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it succeeds, it takes 10d10 necrotic damage.
You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time. You can choose to end the shadow blades harmlessly without using an action.

items: You gain proficiency with improvised weapons (does not grant a weapon at level 1)
You gain proficiency with {@item quarterstaff|phb|quarterstaff}.
You gain proficiency with {@item shield|phb|shields}.
You gain proficiency with {@item shortbow|phb|shortbows}.
You gain proficiency in {@skill perception} or {@skill insight}

subclassFeature.name: Sohei Abilities
entries: You may make a single weapon attack with an unarmed strike, quarterstaff or improvised weapon as a bonus action. (no attack action required)
You may take the {@action dash} action as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Sohei Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield your armor class equals 10 + Dexterity modifier + your intelligence modifier. Your body is wreathed in a light shadow energy that is barely discernible to the eye.

subclassFeature.name: Sohei Hit Point Bonus
entries: Sohei gain an additional +1 to their hp every time they level up in this class as well as when they choose this monastic kata at level 1.

subclassFeature.name: Kata Improvement
entries: You may now attack twice as a bonus action as part of your Sohei ability.

subclassFeature.name: Peak Kata Improvement
entries: Your mastery of life energy opens the door to the ultimate mercy.

As an action, you can touch the corpse of a creature that died within the past 24 hours and expend 4 chakra points. The creature then returns to life, regaining a number of hit points equal to 4d10 + your Wisdom modifier. If the creature died while subject to any of the following conditions, it revives with them removed: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, and stunned.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items: You gain proficiency with a one handed melee weapons (gain two of those weapons instead of one).
You gain proficiency with light and medium armor.
You gain proficiency with {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows} (and any other one handed range weapons that apply to the setting) (gain two of those weapons instead of one).
You gain proficiency in {@skill persuasion} or {@skill deception}

subclassFeature.name: Aramusha Abilities
entries: You gain the fighting style feat, you can only select the 'Dual Wielding' fighting style from the list of fighting styles as part of the Aramusha feature.

subclassFeature.name: Aramusha Minimum Armor Defense
entries: Regardless of armor class your armor provides, provided you are proficient with it you your minimum armor class is equals 10 + [your Dexterity modifier or strength modifier (whichever is higher)] + your Charisma modifier.
If you are wielding at least one weapon in each hand that you are proficient with, you gain +1 to your armor class.

subclassFeature.name: Aramusha Hit Point Bonus
entries: Aramusha gain an additional +1 to their hp every time they level up in this class as well as when they choose this monastic kata at level 1

subclassFeature.name: Kata Improvement
entries: You may add your charisma modifier to your weapon attacks you make while dual wielding.

subclassFeature.name: Peak Kata Improvement
entries: You can activate two stance jutsu if one of them is the Tiger stance jutsu. You gain the tiger stance jutsu if you do not know it, it does not count against the number of jutsu known.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Conquest
entries: Strength above all
You must douse the flames of hope
An Iron fist

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Conquest Spells
rows: {@spell armor of frozen agony|NICKED}, {@spell bane|NICKED}, {@spell cause fear|NICKED}, {@spell command|NICKED}, {@spell divine favor|NICKED}, {@spell shield|NICKED}, {@spell zephyr strike|NICKED}

{@spell enlarge/reduce|NICKED}, {@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell hold person|NICKED}, {@spell spiritual weapon|NICKED}, {@spell suggestion|NICKED}, {@spell warding bond|NICKED}, {@spell hold person|NICKED}, {@spell spiritual weapon|NICKED}, {@spell zone of truth|NICKED}
{@spell bestow curse|NICKED}, {@spell crusader's mantle|NICKED}, {@spell fear|NICKED}, {@spell speak with dead|NICKED}, {@spell spirit guardians|NICKED}
{@spell banishment|NICKED}, {@spell dominate beast|NICKED}, {@spell death ward|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell freedom of movement|NICKED}, {@spell spirit of death|NICKED}
{@spell cloudkill|NICKED}, {@spell dominate person|NICKED}, {@spell hold monster|NICKED}, {@spell holy weapon|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Weight of Character
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill intimidation} skill. If you already had proficiency in this skill double your proficiency bonus with that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Oath options.

subclassFeature.name: Conquering Presence
entries: You can use your Channel Oath to exude a terrifying presence. As an action, you force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Strike
entries: You can use your Channel Oath to strike with supernatural accuracy. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Oath to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.
A creature hit by this attack takes psychic damage equal to your paladin level.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Conquest
entries: Starting at 7th level, you constantly emanate a menacing aura while you're not {@condition incapacitated}. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover.
Creatures have disadvantage on saves against paladin features and spell you cast while within the aura.
If a hostile creature is {@condition frightened} of you, its speed is reduced to 0 while in the aura.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Scornful Rebuke
entries: Starting at 15th level, those who dare to strike you are psychically punished for their audacity. Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, that creature takes psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) if you're not {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Invincible Conqueror
entries: At 20th level, you become a near unstoppable force. While in combat, you gain the following abilities:

items: Once during each round, refreshing at the start of your turn, you may reduce all damage from a single source to 0. You may still suffer other effects from that source as normal. If a source deals damage multiple times, you only reduce one instance of that damage to 0.
Your extra attack improves, allowing you to attack 3 times when you take the {@action attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Devotion
entries: Do not lie
Have courage enough for others to share
Duty is Compassion

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Devotion Spells
rows: {@spell absorb elements|NICKED}, {@spell bless|NICKED}, {@spell expeditious retreat|NICKED}, {@spell guiding bolt|NICKED}, {@spell healing word|NICKED}, {@spell protection from evil and good|NICKED}, {@spell sanctuary|NICKED}

{@spell borrowed knowledge|NICKED}, {@spell calm emotions|NICKED}, {@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell lesser restoration|NICKED}, {@spell prayer of healing|NICKED}, {@spell silence|NICKED}, {@spell zone of truth|NICKED}
{@spell beacon of hope|NICKED}, {@spell clairvoyance|NICKED}, {@spell create food and water|NICKED}, {@spell dispel magic|NICKED}, {@spell slow|NICKED}, {@spell tongues|NICKED}
{@spell aura of purity|NICKED}, {@spell compulsion|NICKED}, {@spell dimension door|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell freedom of movement|NICKED}, {@spell guardian of faith|NICKED}
{@spell commune|NICKED}, {@spell greater restoration|NICKED}, {@spell summon celestial|NICKED}, {@spell wall of light|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Devotion's Bulwark
entries: Starting at 1st level, your body gains a symbol blessed by your oath. This grants you the effects of {@spell blade ward|NICKED}. This effect lasts until it reduces a source of damage in which the sigil darkens, and you lose the effect.
Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you regain the sigil's effect.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Oath options:

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can imbue one weapon that you are holding with positive energy, using your Channel Oath. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon (with a minimum bonus of +1). The weapon also emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that. If the weapon is not already magical, it becomes magical for the duration.
You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you are no longer holding or carrying this weapon, or if you fall {@condition unconscious}, this effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Gilded Words
entries: Whenever you fail a {@skill persuasion} or {@skill performance} check, you may expend a use of your Channel Oath feature to reroll that check possibly turning it into a success; you must use the new roll.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Devotion
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be {@condition charmed} while you are conscious.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Purity of Spirit
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you are always under the effects of a {@spell protection from evil and good|NICKED} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Judge
entries: Starting at 20th level, whenever you expend a spell slot to fuel your Divine Smite feature or cast a spell, count that spell slot as one level higher (you may expend 1st level spell slots to cast 2nd level spells and so on).

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Redemption
entries: Patience begets Peace
With Wisdom you must guide people forward
Return to Innocence

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Redemption Spells
rows: {@spell bless|NICKED}, {@spell charm person|NICKED}, {@spell cure wounds|NICKED}, {@spell healing word|NICKED}, {@spell sanctuary|NICKED}, {@spell shield of faith|NICKED}, {@spell sleep|NICKED}

{@spell aid|NICKED}, {@spell calm emotions|NICKED}, {@spell enhance ability|NICKED}, {@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell hold person|NICKED}, {@spell lesser restoration|NICKED}, {@spell misty step|NICKED}
{@spell antagonize|NICKED}, {@spell catnap|NICKED}, {@spell counterspell|NICKED}, {@spell mass healing word|NICKED}, {@spell remove curse|NICKED}, {@spell revivify|NICKED}
{@spell aura of life|NICKED}, {@spell compulsion|NICKED}, {@spell death ward|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell polymorph|NICKED}, {@spell stoneskin|NICKED}
{@spell greater restoration|NICKED}, {@spell geas|NICKED}, {@spell mass cure wounds|NICKED}, {@spell raise dead|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Redeem the Flesh
entries: Starting at 1st level, whenever you use your Lay on Hands class feature, the creature affected gains temporary hitpoints equal to your charisma modifier.
If you affect multiple creatures with a single effect, select one of those creatures to receive the temporary hitpoints.
These temporary hitpoints last until your next short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Oath options:

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of Peace
entries: You can use your Channel Oath to augment your presence with divine power. As a bonus action, you grant yourself a +5 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for the next 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Rebuke the Violent
entries: You can use your Channel Oath to rebuke those who use violence. Immediately after an attacker within 30 feet of you deals damage with an attack against a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker takes radiant damage equal to the damage it just dealt. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Guardian
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can shield others from harm at the cost of your own health. When a creature within 10 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to magically take that damage, instead of that creature taking it. This feature doesn't transfer any other effects that might accompany the damage, and this damage can't be reduced in any way.
If you use 'Rebuke the Violent' Channel Oath, you may use this feature as part of that reaction regardless of how far they are from you.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Spirit
entries: Starting at 15th level, a holy presence mends your wounds in battle. You regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your paladin level if you end your turn in combat with fewer than half of your hit points remaining and you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of Redemption
entries: At 20th level, you become an avatar of peace, which gives you two benefits:

items: You have resistance to all damage dealt by other creatures (their attacks, spells, and other effects).
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, it takes radiant damage equal to half the damage you take from the attack.

entries: If you attack a creature, cast a spell on it, or deal damage to it by any means but this feature, neither benefit works against that creature until you finish a long rest.
Your maximum hitpoints increase by 10 x your charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
You gain an additional reaction each round. This reaction can only be used on your Aura of the Guardian class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Ancients
entries: Shelter the Light
Bring nature's simple beauty to those lost
Be a constant

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Ancients Spells
rows: {@spell absorb elements|NICKED}, {@spell comprehend languages|NICKED}, {@spell detect poison and disease|NICKED}, {@spell earth tremor|NICKED}, {@spell ensnaring strike|NICKED}, {@spell entangle|NICKED}, {@spell goodberry|NICKED}

{@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell healing spirit|NICKED}, {@spell moonbeam|NICKED}, {@spell protection from poison|NICKED}, {@spell see invisibility|NICKED}, {@spell warding wind|NICKED}, {@spell web|NICKED}
{@spell elemental weapon|NICKED}, {@spell erupting earth|NICKED}, {@spell meld into stone|NICKED}, {@spell plant growth|NICKED}, {@spell protection from energy|NICKED}, {@spell remove curse|NICKED}
{@spell charm monster|NICKED}, {@spell control water|NICKED}, {@spell elemental bane|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell grasping vine|NICKED}, {@spell summon elemental|NICKED}
{@spell awaken|NICKED}, {@spell tree stride|NICKED}, {@spell telekinesis|NICKED}, {@spell wrath of nature|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Seal
entries: Starting at 1st level, you carry a seal deep in your very soul, this may or may not manifest itself on your body (your choice). If it manifests, it takes the form of a small growing tree branch with one or more leaves. Your skin may become mildly like bark, you may sweat sap, or your hair may take the form of willow branches.
This seal grants you any or all of the following features and you may choose if and when these features take effect, cease to effect, or begin to affect you again:

items: Your body ceases to age.
You cannot be aged magically
You suffer none of the drawbacks of old age

entries: If you choose to have your body cease to age, any growths of plant matter created by this feature may still bely your age and continue to grow, talk with your DM on how this may affect you.
Other features of your body will still go through cycles of growth such as hair, nails, etc.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Oath options

entries.subclassFeature: Boon of the Elder Beast|Paladin N|NICKED|Ancients|NICKED|3|NICKED

subclassFeature.name: Boon of the Elder Beast
entries: You may use your Channel Oath as a bonus action and draw upon the primal energy rooted in your very soul to augment your body gaining one of the following effects:

items: Your weapon or hands become covered in thorns. Your attacks gain +1 to hit and damage rolls (to a maximum of +3 on your weapon or unarmed strikes). Then thorns grow from your body and continue to grow and cover any weapon you pick up or use.
At the start of each of your turns, you gain temporary hit points equal to your charisma modifier.
Your movement speed increases by 10 ft.

entries: This effect lasts for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Warden
entries: As an action, you can channel the natural magics found everywhere around you to draw upon nature to aid you. You can use your Channel Oath to cast one of the following spells:

items: {@spell animal friendship|NICKED}
{@spell beast bond|NICKED}
{@spell speak with animals|NICKED}
{@spell beast sense|NICKED}

entries: These spells do not have their normal duration and last until the start of your next short or long rest instead of their usual duration.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Warding
entries: Beginning at 7th level, ancient magic lies so heavily upon you that it forms an eldritch ward. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to damage from spells.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Anchor
entries: Starting at 15th level, if a creature attempts to use any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence, you may use your reaction to block that effect. That creature remains blocked from attempting to travel or teleport until the start of your next turn.
If a creature used a spell slot, ability, or effect with limited used to move, it is not consumed. (However, the creature still loses any actions used in the attempt.)
You cannot prevent the creature from passing through an interdimensional portal.

If you perform a one-hour ritual upon a creature who is restrained or willing, you block any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence the creature attempts. This effect lasts until you end it as an action, until 48 hours pass, or until the creature moves over 250 ft away from you. If a creature is affected by this effect, you cannot use your reaction to block a creature from attempting such travel

subclassFeature.name: Undying Sentinel
entries: Starting at 20th level, your body defies death. While you are reduced to 0 hit points and are not killed outright, you do not fall unconscious. You no longer need to make death saves.
While you have 0 hit points, you gain the following effects:

items: You have disadvantage on all strength and dexterity ability checks
You have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and effects that would make you {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}.
You cannot {@action attack} more than once per turn.
You cannot cast leveled spells.
An ancient seal appears on your forehead (resembling your ancient seal on your soul.
You can be killed outright if you suffer damage in a single turn (not just one single attack, effect, or spell) equal to your maximum hp.
If you would gain temporary hitpoints, you gain hitpoints instead.
You cannot take short or long rests.

entries: If you body would be destroyed, dismembered, or becom beyond repair, it reforms withing 1 minute from the largest piece (unless you are killed outright). Even spells like {@spell disintegrate|NICKED} do not destroy your body permanently (you will reform in 1 minute).

entries.name: Ritual of the Seal
entries: While you are restrained or willing (or stuck in some way) and at 0 hitpoints, a creature with the proper knowledge can perform a 1-hour ritual consuming 100gp worth of incense and a diamond worth 200gp to end your undying vigil, causing you to die. Certain spells such as {@spell legend lore|NICKED} can reveal the details of this ritual. It may also be found at the location in which you undertook this oath. It may also be found in such places like ancient texts or gained from a deity's instruction. This ritual fails if you move more than 5 feet from the creature performing the ritual.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Last Vigil|Paladin N|NICKED|Last Vigil|NICKED|1|NICKED

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Last Vigil
entries: The Hunt Eternal
Vigilance in duty will bring peace everywhere
Discipline saves lives

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of the Last Vigil table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of the Last Vigil Spells
rows: {@spell alarm|NICKED}, {@spell feather fall|NICKED}, {@spell hail of thorns|NICKED}, {@spell hunter's mark|NICKED}, {@spell jump|NICKED}, {@spell purify food and drink|NICKED}, {@spell silent image|NICKED}

{@spell borrowed knowledge|NICKED}, {@spell darkness|NICKED}, {@spell enhance ability|NICKED}, {@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell invisibility|NICKED}, {@spell summon beast|NICKED}, {@spell vortex warp|NICKED}
{@spell elemental munitions|NICKED}, {@spell nondetection|NICKED}, {@spell revivify|NICKED}, {@spell speak with dead|NICKED}, {@spell tiny hut|NICKED}, {@spell water breathing|NICKED}

{@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell freedom of movement|NICKED}, {@spell fabricate|NICKED}, {@spell hallucinatory terrain|NICKED}, {@spell locate creature|NICKED}, {@spell secret chest|NICKED}
{@spell conjure volley|NICKED}, {@spell mislead|NICKED}, {@spell passwall|NICKED}, {@spell wall of stone|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Vigil's Training
entries: You ignore Complex Loading on ranged weapons.
You gain proficiency in {@skill athletics} or {@skill stealth}. If you already had proficiency in this skill, double your proficiency bonus with that skill

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: You gain the following Channel Oath options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Oath works.

subclassFeature.name: Vigil's Hunt
entries: You use your channel oath as an action to start the ancient hunt and bolster yourself. You gain the ability to see in magical darkness, darkness, and dim light as though it was bright light. You do not have disadvantage on ranged attacks while creatures are within 5 ft of you.
This effect lasts until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Path
entries: You use your channel oath as an action to call upon the last vigil's ancestors to travel quickly and quietly.
You and a number of other creatures equal to 2 x your charisma modifier can travel at a normal pace while traveling stealthily. This effect lasts until you finish a short or long rest.
In addition, if you would be surprised in combat, you may end this effect early to act normally on the first turn in that combat.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of Alacrity
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your walking speed increases by 10ft.
Additionally, you may use an action to bless a creature other than yourself and enhance its movement. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your charisma modifier.

This blessing lasts until you choose to end the effect on the creature (no action required), the blessed creature dies, or you die. If the effect of the blessing ends on a creature for any reason, you recover that expended use of this feature.
At 18th level, this bonus movement increases to 20 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Defender of the Last
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can defend your allies and yourself with the spirits of the vigil.

When you or another creature you can see within the range of your weapon is hit by an attack roll, you can grant that creature a bonus to their armor class against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. This bonus equals your charisma modifier (minimum of +1).
As part of that reaction, you may make one weapon attack against that creature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Legend of the Last Vigil
entries: Starting at 20th level, you follow in the steps of your forbears leading the hunt.
You are always under the effects of the {@spell freedom of movement|NICKED} spell.

You increase your [Strength or Dexterity] and your charisma by 2; your maximum for those scores is now 22. Once on each of your turns when you make a weapon attack and miss, you can cause that attack to hit instead.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Malice
entries: Hatred and Love
Forget all else but those you Hate
Remember your Support

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Malice Spells
rows: {@spell bane|NICKED}, {@spell disguise self|NICKED}, {@spell fog cloud|NICKED}, {@spell hellish rebuke|NICKED}, {@spell inflict wounds|NICKED}, {@spell longstrider|NICKED}, {@spell ray of sickness|NICKED}

{@spell crown of madness|NICKED}, {@spell detect thoughts|NICKED}, {@spell enthrall|NICKED}, {@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell mind spike|NICKED}, {@spell phantasmal force|NICKED}, {@spell spiritual weapon|NICKED}
{@spell bestow curse|NICKED}, {@spell fear|NICKED}, {@spell feign death|NICKED}, {@spell fly|NICKED}, {@spell speak with dead|NICKED}, {@spell summon undead|NICKED}
{@spell evard's black tentacles|NICKED}, {@spell blight|NICKED}, {@spell confusion|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell shadow of moil|NICKED}
{@spell contagion|NICKED}, {@spell infernal calling|NICKED}, {@spell modify memory|NICKED}, {@spell raise dead|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Minor Corruption
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency in {@skill deception}.

When you finish a long rest, you can corrupt a number of willing creatures in addition to yourself equal to your charisma modifier (minimum of 1) providing them a dark blessing. This blessing lasts until your next long rest.
While corrupted in this way, a creature gains the following benefits:

items: They may use your deception skill bonus in place of their own if they are within 30ft of you.

When a creature gains this blessing, they gain {@dice 1d4} + your charisma bonus as maximum hp. They heal for that same amount of hp. This hp lasts until the creature loses this blessing. (roll only once when you bestow corruption and apply it to all affected creatures). The dice you roll increases at certain levels.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Oath options

subclassFeature.name: Dark Presence
entries: As an action you may expend a use of your channel oath. You become wreathed in shadows that defend you and lash out at those who oppose you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain +2 to your Armor Class.

Whenever you cast {@spell hellish rebuke|NICKED}, it does not require somatic components, and it counts as thought you cast it one level higher than the spell slot you expended. You may have it deal radiant or necrotic damage instead of fire damage (your choice).

entries: This feature lasts for 1 minute or until you choose to end it (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Castigation
entries: You may expend a use of your channel oath as a reaction whenever you see a friendly corrupted creature within 60 ft take damage from a hostile creature you can see.
You may teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 ft of the friendly creature or teleport up to 120 ft to an unoccupied space within 5 ft of the hostile creature that was the source of the damage.
After you teleport in this way, each creature of you choice within 10 ft of you takes psychic damage equal to your paladin level.
This teleportation does not trigger attacks of opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Paladin of Dark or Self-Serving Oaths
entries: Starting at 3rd level, whenever a paladin feature deals radiant damage, you may have that feature deal the necrotic damage instead. (You must choose which damage type before rolling or applying damage)

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Hate
entries: Starting at 7th level, the paladin, as well any corrupted creatures within 10 feet of the paladin, gains a bonus to unarmed strikes and weapon damage rolls equal to the paladin's Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Will
entries: Starting at 15th level, you are always under the effect of your Dark Presence channel oath feature. You may choose whether or not you're wreathed in shadow (you may choose this at any time, no action required).

Whenever you make a weapon attack or unarmed strike and expend a spell slot to fuel your divine smite feature, creatures dealt damage by that attack cannot regain hitpoints until the end of your next turn.
You become immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Lord
entries: Starting at 20th level, you control the shadows that surround you and creatures blessed by your corruption.
You may use a bonus action to cause the shadows to attack a creature that the paladin can see (no maximum range).

You make a melee spell attack, if that attack hits the target takes {@damage 3d10} radiant or necrotic damage + your charisma modifier. Creatures dealt damage by this attack suffer the effects of the {@spell bane|NICKED} spell for one minute (no concentration required).
You become immune to radiant and necrotic damage.
Your auras always apply to creatures effected by corruption regardless of distance. (though as usual, you must remain conscious)

If you would drop to 0 hitpoints, a corrupted creature can sacrifice some of their life force expending an amount of hitpoints of their choice. Your hitpoints becomes equal to this expended hitpoints (this is not healing). That corrupted creature cannot use this feature again until they finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Vengeance
entries: Fight Greater Evil
Bring no Mercy for the Wicked ones
Restitution for Misdeeds

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Vengeance Spells
rows: {@spell compelled duel|NICKED}, {@spell cure wounds|NICKED}, {@spell detect magic|NICKED}, {@spell guiding bolt|NICKED}, {@spell hex|NICKED}, {@spell shield|NICKED}, {@spell snare|NICKED}
{@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell hold person|NICKED}, {@spell knock|NICKED}, {@spell locate object|NICKED}, {@spell misty step|NICKED}, {@spell vortex warp|NICKED}, {@spell zone of truth|NICKED}
{@spell elemental weapon|NICKED}, {@spell haste|NICKED}, {@spell mass healing word|NICKED}, {@spell sending|NICKED}, {@spell slow|NICKED}, {@spell summon shadowspawn|NICKED}
{@spell death ward|NICKED}, {@spell dimension door|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell psychic lance|NICKED}, {@spell wall of fire|NICKED}
{@spell geas|NICKED}, {@spell greater restoration|NICKED}, {@spell hold monster|NICKED}, {@spell scrying|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Spirit
entries: Starting at 1st level, if you are reduced to 0 hitpoints, your very spirit retaliates against creatures that caused you harm.
Whenever you make a death saving throw, your spirit uses that roll to make a spell attack using a spiritual weapon of your choice (see chart below).

When a creature makes a weapon or spell attack against you while you are at 0 hitpoints, your spirit retaliates. After the creature makes the attack roll against you, you make a spell attack roll using a spiritual weapon of your choice (see chart below) against the creature.
If you would die as a result of an attack or death save, your spirit still makes the attack and then disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Oath options.

subclassFeature.name: Abjure Enemy
entries: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer of denunciation, using your Channel Oath. Choose one creature within 60 feet of you that you can see. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, unless it is immune to being {@condition frightened}. Creatures affected by your hex spell have disadvantage on this saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. While {@condition frightened}, the creature's speed is 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
On a successful save, the creature's speed is halved for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Vow of Enmity
entries: As a bonus action, you can utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 10 feet of you, using your Channel Oath. You gain advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points or falls {@condition unconscious}.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Focus
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emit an aura of alertness while you aren't incapacitated. When you and any creatures of you choic within 10 ft of you roll initiative, you all gain a bonus to initiative equal to you proficiency bonus.
At 18th level, range of this aura increases to 30 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Vengeance
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain 3 additional uses of your Channel Oath feature between rests.

Whenever you take the an attack of opportunity instead of making a single weapon attack, you may take an action. If you take the {@action attack} action, you can take 2 attacks as part of that action.

subclassFeature.name: Avenging Angel
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of an angelic avenger. You gain the following features:

items: Wings sprout from your back and grant you a flying speed of 60 feet.

Your Vow of Emnity channel oath range increases to 60 ft. Whenever you use your Vow of Emnity, an affected creature also becomes affected by your Abjure Enemy channel oath feature (this still costs only 1 channel oath).
Whenever you expend a spell slot to cast a spell or fuel a class feature, you regain hitpoints equal to 4 x the level of the spell slot.
Whenever your Vengeful Spirit class feature hits with its spiritual weapon attack, you may expend spell slots to use you Divine Smite class feature with that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Oathbreaker Tenets
entries: Your path Ascendent ignores all for the glory and focus of one's own beliefs above any oath or any other's beliefs, be they gods or otherwise. You have no oath, and you care little.

subclassFeature.name: Oathbreaker Spells
entries: You gain oathbreaker spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oathbreaker Spells
rows: {@spell bless|NICKED}, {@spell charm person|NICKED}, {@spell comprehend languages|NICKED}, {@spell feather fall|NICKED}, {@spell healing word|NICKED}, {@spell longstrider|NICKED}, {@spell shield|NICKED}

{@spell aid|NICKED}, {@spell borrowed knowledge|NICKED}, {@spell calm emotions|NICKED}, {@spell detect thoughts|NICKED}, {@spell find steed|NICKED}, {@spell invisibility|NICKED}, {@spell spiritual weapon|NICKED}
{@spell call lightning|NICKED}, {@spell dispel magic|NICKED}, {@spell fear|NICKED}, {@spell haste|NICKED}, {@spell remove curse|NICKED}, {@spell water breathing|NICKED}
{@spell aura of purity|NICKED}, {@spell dimension door|NICKED}, {@spell dominate beast|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}, {@spell polymorph|NICKED}
{@spell dominate person|NICKED}, {@spell raise dead|NICKED}, {@spell mass cure wounds|NICKED}, {@spell scrying|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Force of Ascension
entries: Starting at 1st level or when you undertake this subclass, gain a first level feature of another paladin subclass that is (not its oath spell list), or retain the [non-oath spell list]; first level feature of your previous subclass.

In addition to that feature, you infuse yourself with your own divine energy and forgo the tenets of any oath drawing on the path of ascension that other beings before you have tread. You may cast {@spell thaumaturgy|NICKED} without verbal, somatic, or material components.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Oath
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Oath options.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendent's Focus
entries: As a bonus action you may expend a use of your channel oath. For the next 1 minute, choose Strength, Dexterity, or Charisma. You have +5 to all checks you make with that ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Pressure
entries: As a bonus action, you channel your inner power to bolster your attacks for 1 minute. Once per turn for the duration, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can choose to push the target 10 feet away from you. If pushed into an obstacle or another creature, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Paladin of Dark or Self-Serving Oaths
entries: Starting at 3rd level, whenever a paladin feature deals radiant damage, you may have that feature deal the necrotic damage instead. (You must choose which damage type before rolling or applying damage)

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Liberation
entries: Starting at 7th level, you fill nearby creatures with the energy of movement.

While you're not incapacitated, you and creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you cannot be grappled or restrained, and ignore penalties on movement and attacks due to naturally occurring/nonmagical environments, such as dense foliage, blizzards, underwater, heavy winds, or another natural phenomenon.
Creatures that are already grappled or restrained when they enter the aura can spend 5 ft of movement to automatically escape unless they are bound by magic restraints.
When you reach 18th level in this class, the aura increases to 30 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendant's Resistance
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Path to Godhood
entries: Starting at 20th level, you gain a divine spark allowing you to attempt the ritual of ascension.
Additionally, you gain 1 legendary resistance that recovers upon finishing a short or long rest.
You have advantage on all attack rolls.
You have truesight with a range of 120 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Ambusher
entries: At 3rd level, you master the art of the ambush. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier.
You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from your race, its range increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Momentum
entries: You have a number of points as shown in the chart below based on your ranger level. These points a refueled by taking the attack action a rolling initiative. You have 2 max momentum points at 3rd level, which increases to 3 at 7th level and 4 at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Momentum
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a pool of momentum points that can be used to fuel various abilities.
Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you regain all expended uses of momentum.
{@bold After} you roll initiative or take the {@action attack} action and make at least one weapon attack against a hostile creature, you regain 1 point of momentum.

subclassFeature.name: Feral Attack
entries: You may expend 2 points as part of taking the {@action attack} action during your turn. You make an additional weapon attack as part of that action.
You can activate this once per turn.
At 15th level, you may use this on opportunity attacks as thought you took the {@action attack} action.

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Rush
entries: You may expend 1 point during your turn to increase your walking speed by 10 ft until the end of your turn.
You can activate this only once per turn.
At 15th level, this movement speed increases to 15 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Launch
entries: You may expend 1 point during your turn to double your jumping distance until the end of your turn.
You can activate this only once per turn.
At 15th level, you triple your jumping distance.

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Eye
entries: After you make a {@skill perception} check, you may expend 1 point to reroll that roll; you must use the new roll.
You can activate this only once per turn.
At 15th level, you may use this feature on {@skill investigation} checks

subclassFeature.name: Iron Mind
entries: Starting at 7th level, you have honed your ability to resist the mind-altering powers of your prey. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Flurry
entries: At 11th level, you learn to attack with such unexpected speed that you can turn a miss into another strike. Once on each of your turns when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

entries.subclassFeature: Overwhelming Momentum: Adrenaline Rush|Ranger N|NICKED|Gloom Stalker|NICKED|11|NICKED

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Momentum: Adrenaline Rush
entries: When you roll initiative, you may expend 1 use of momentum to ignore the {@condition surprised} condition (you may use this feature even if you're not surprised).
At 15th level, you gain advantage on each attack you make against each unique hostile creature during the first turn of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowy Aggression
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain the following:

items: You may use your Feral Attack feature on opportunity attacks as thought they were the attack action.
Whenever you use your Stalker's Rush feature, it increases your movement speed by 15 ft instead.
Whenevery you use you Umbral Launch feature, triple your jumping distance.
You may use your Stalker's Eye feature on {@skill investigation} checks as well as {@skill perception}.
Whenever you use your Adrenaline Rush feature, you gain advantage on the first attack you make against each unique hostile creature you attack during your first turn in combat.

entries.subclassFeature: Overwhelming Momentum: Shadowy Dodge|Ranger N|NICKED|Gloom Stalker|NICKED|15|NICKED

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Momentum: Shadowy Dodge
entries: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction and 1 momentum to halve the attack's damage against you.

subclassFeature.name: Green Rider Spells
entries: You learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Green Rider Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

entries.caption: Green Rider Spells
rows: {@spell heroism|NICKED}, choose {@spell hunter's mark|NICKED} or {@spell ensnaring strike|NICKED}
{@spell freedom of movement|NICKED}, {@spell find greater steed|NICKED}

subclassFeature.name: Additional Tools
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with land vehicles and water vehicles. Double your proficiency bonus with those tools.

subclassFeature.name: Warden's Strike
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you may use this feature to do one of the following:

items: Once per turn whenever you or your mount make a melee weapon attack against a creature affected by your {@spell hunter's mark|NICKED}, you gain advantage on that attack.
Once per turn when you or your mount hit a creature with a melee attack that is restrained by your {@spell ensnaring strike|NICKED}, you deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage to that creature.

entries: You may use this feature a number of times equal to your wisdom modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Warden's Steed
entries: Starting at 3rd level whenever you finish a long rest, you may perform a ritual to cast {@spell find steed|NICKED} without expending a spell slot.

Your dm may allow you to bond with more creatures than listed in the initial spell of {@spell find steed|NICKED} or {@spell find greater steed|NICKED} such as if you want to ride a beast or elemental.

Steeds summoned by {@spell find steed|NICKED} or {@spell find greater steed|NICKED} do not count against the familiar limit and gain the following additional properties while you are not incapacitated.

items: While you are mounted on your steed, your mount is protected by a nature's veil preventing them from coming to direct harm. Reduce all damage the creature would take to 0.
Your steed cannot take any action other than {@action dash} or {@action disengage}.
Your steed shares your turn in combat. You may choose which order you and your steed act and can interchange parts of your turns

You can replace any weapon attack to command the creature to make a weapon attack using it's natural weapons. This attack is a melee attack that deals {@damage 2d6} damage and uses your wisdom modifier for attack and damage rolls.
At 17th level, whenever you cast {@spell mislead|NICKED}, it also creates an illusory duplicate of your mount, and your mount also becomes invisible.

subclassFeature.name: Green Rider's Veil
entries: Starting at 7th level, whenever you or your mount are subjected to a spell or effect that would cause the conditions {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition frightened}, or reduce you or your mount's movement speed, you ignore that part of the effect. You can do this once per short or long rest. You may use this feature twice between rests at 15th level.
Your mount may use your saving throws in place of its own when it makes a saving throw while you are mounted on it.

subclassFeature.name: Master Cavalier
entries: Starting at 11th level, you cannot be knocked off your mount unless you chose to be by any spell or effect if you not incapacitated. If a spell or effect would teleport you or your mount you may follow your mount as part of that effect if you are mounted on it.
You may cast {@spell find steed|NICKED} and {@spell find greater steed|NICKED} as an action instead of its usual casting time.

subclassFeature.name: Rider's Strike
entries: Starting at 11th level, once per turn whenever you or your steed makes a melee attack roll with advantage, you may forgo advantage to make two attacks instead.

subclassFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Starting at 15th level, whenever you and/or your mount are subjected to an effect, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or a {@spell lighting bolt|NICKED} spell, that allows one or both of you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you and/or your mount instead take no damage if you and/or your mount succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you and/or your mount fail.

subclassFeature.name: Headhunter Spells
entries: You learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Headhunter Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Headhunter's Prep
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with poisoner's kit and improvised weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Captive Watch
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have advantage on all checks you make when determining the security of a creature that you have personally {@condition restrained}. You are more likely to notice something amiss, illusions placed, or if a prisoner or captive that you have {@condition restrained} yourself would make an escape attempt.

subclassFeature.name: Ensnare Prey
entries: Starting at 3rd level, whenever you cast {@spell ensnaring strike|NICKED} as a bonus action, you may make a single weapon attack as part of casting that spell using a weapon you are wielding.
You may choose to remove the concentration from {@spell ensnaring strike|NICKED} when you cast it. If you do, the duration is reduced to “until the end of your next turn”.

You may cast {@spell ensnaring strike|NICKED} a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded up without expending a spell slot. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tracker's Sense
entries: Starting at 7th level, you ignore the effects of {@spell pass without trace|NICKED}, vanish, or other similar abilities when attempting to track a creature with mundane means.
You have a bonus to all {@skill investigation} rolls you make that is equal to your wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Toxin Therapy
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you gain this feature, you gain resistance to a damage type that is {@bold not} piercing, bludgeoning, slashing, or force damage.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you may grant a number of other willing creatures equal to your proficiency bonus resistance to a damage type that you are resistant to.

subclassFeature.name: Headhunting
entries: Starting at 11th level while in combat when you critically strike with a weapon attack, reduce a creature to 0 hit points, or a hostile creature fails a saving throw against one of your spells, you gain a headhunting action.
Headhunting actions can only be used to {@action dash}, {@action use an item}, make a skill check, or make a single weapon attack.

You can have up to 1 headhunting action stored at a time. You cannot use the headhunting action more than once each turn, and it can only be used on your turn. If combat ends, all unused headhunting actions are lost.

subclassFeature.name: Traversal
entries: Starting at 15th level when you {@action dash}, {@action disengage}, or {@action hide}, your walking speed increases by 15ft.
(This distance is added “before” calculating the amount of movement you have from dashing. For example, if you have 35ft of movement and {@action dash}, you would have 100ft of movement.)

subclassFeature.name: Improved Toxin Therapy
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain an additional resistance of your choice when you gain the benefits of your “Toxin Therapy” class feature. (You still cannot choose piercing, bludgeoning, slashing, or force damage)

subclassFeature.name: Horizon Walker Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Horizon Walker Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Detect Portal
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to magically sense the presence of a planar portal. As an action, you detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile of you. If there are no portals or if all portals in range are hidden from divination magic, your sense returns 'no indication of a local portal'.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
See the "Planar Travel" section in chapter 2 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for examples of planar portals.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Warrior
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to draw on the energy of the multiverse to augment your attacks.

As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The next time you hit that creature on this turn with a weapon attack, all damage dealt by the attack becomes force damage, and the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage from the attack. When you reach 11th level in this class, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: At 7th level, you learn to step through the Ethereal Plane. As a bonus action, you can cast the {@spell etherealness|NICKED} spell with this feature, without expending a spell slot, but the spell ends at the end of the current turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Distant Strike
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to pass between the planes in the blink of an eye. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space you can see.
If you attack at least two different creatures with the action, you can make one additional attack with it against a third creature.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Defense
entries: At 15th level, your ability to move between planes enables you to slip through the planar boundaries to lessen the harm done to you during battle. When you take damage from a hostile creature, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to all damage dealt by this creature until the end of this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Teleportation
entries: At 15th level, once per long rest you may cast {@spell teleport|NICKED} without expending a spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
This ability improves at 17th level allowing you to cast {@spell gate|NICKED} once without expending a spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Monster Slayer Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Sense
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to peer at a creature and magically discern how best to hurt it. As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. You immediately learn whether the creature has any damage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities and what they are. If the creature is hidden from divination magic, you sense that it has no damage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Prey
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can focus your ire on one foe, increasing the harm you inflict on it. As a bonus action, you designate one hostile creature you can see within 60 feet of you as the target of this feature. The first time each turn that you hit that target with a weapon attack, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage from the weapon.
You can use this feature once during each of your turns. The benefits last until you finish a short or long rest. It ends early if you designate a different creature.

subclassFeature.name: Supernatural Defense
entries: At 7th level, you gain extra resilience against your prey's assaults on your mind and body. Whenever a hostile creature you can see forces you to make a saving throw and whenever you make an ability check to escape that target's grapple, add {@dice 1d6} to your roll.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Counter
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to counterattack when your prey tries to sabotage you. If the target of your Slayer's Prey forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against the quarry. You make this attack immediately before making the saving throw. If your attack hits, your save automatically succeeds, in addition to the attack's normal effects.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer Tenacity
entries: At 15th level, when you are subjected to a spell cast by your Slayer's Prey that forces you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Reclaimer Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Reclaimer Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

entries.caption: Reclaimer Spells
rows: {@spell resistance|NICKED}, one 1st level spell from each (Cleric and Warlock)
one 2nd level spell from each (Cleric and Warlock)
one 3rd level spell from each (Cleric and Warlock)
one 4th level spell from each (Cleric and Warlock)
one 5th level spell from each (Cleric and Warlock)

entries: When you gain a level in this class you may swap one spell from the table out for another of the same class and level.

subclassFeature.name: Reclaimer's Armaments
entries: Starting at 3rd level, choose one type of ranged weapon and one type of melee weapon. You may use your wisdom modifier for attack and damage rolls with weapons of those types. They count as magical weapons while you wield them.
Those weapons count as spell focuses for your ranger spells
Weapons of the chosen type deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage.

subclassFeature.name: God Hunter
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill religion}. If you were already proficient, then double your proficiency bonus on checks using that skill.
You can read and write {@language celestial} and {@language infernal}

subclassFeature.name: Enigmatic Soul
entries: Starting at 3rd level, whenever you cast a ranger spell you choose as part of your reclaimer spells or regular ranger spells gain the following effect:

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Spirit
entries: If you cast a spell gained from the clerics spell list, you may heal a friendly creature within 30ft of you that you can see or that can hear you equal to {@dice 1d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Force
entries: If you cast a spell gained from the warlock spell list, the next creature damaged by one of your reclaimer's armaments within 1 minute causes any creature of size large or smaller to gain the {@condition Reeling|NICKED} condition until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Scorch
entries: If you cast a ranger spell not gained from this subclass, the next creature dealt damage by one of your reclaimer's armaments within 1 minute cannot regain hitpoints until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Spirit
entries: Starting at 7th level, you are immune to the effects (both positive and negative) of divination magic regardless if you allow the effect or not. You cannot be tracked or located magically. (If you allow a spell or ability, you must allow the whole spell or ability.)
You gain resistance to radiant and necrotic damage

subclassFeature.name: Nexus of Hidden Fate
entries: Starting at 11th level, whenever you cast a spell of first level or higher as an action, you may make a single weapon attack as part of that spell. The attack happens before or after you complete the spell as you choose.
This always triggers your Enigmatic Soul before you attack.
You have twice as many first and second level spell slots. (total of 8-1st level and 6-2nd level spells)

subclassFeature.name: Reclaimant Soul
entries: Starting at 15th level, you are always under the effects of the {@spell bless|NICKED} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Swarmkeeper Spells
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand|NICKED} cantrip if you don't already know it. When you cast it, the hand takes the form of your swarming nature spirits.

You also learn an additional spell of 1st level or higher when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Swarmkeeper Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Gathered Swarm
entries: Starting at 3rd level, a swarm of intangible nature spirits has bonded itself to you and can assist you in battle. While you're alive, the swarm remains in your space, crawling on you or flying and skittering around you within your space. You determine its appearance, or you generate its appearance by rolling on the Swarm Appearance table.
Once on each of your turns, you can cause the swarm to assist you in one of the following ways, immediately after you hit a creature with an attack:

items: The attack's target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage from the swarm.
The attack's target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be moved by the swarm up to 15 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.
You are moved by the swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Writhing Tide
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can condense part of your swarm into a focused mass that lifts you up. As a bonus action, you gain a flying speed of 10 feet and can hover. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you are {@condition incapacitated}.
While attended by the swarm in this way, you gain temporary hit points at the start of every turn equal to your wisdom modifier, and you double your jumping distance.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Swarm
entries: Starting at 11th level, your Gathered Swarm grows mightier in the following ways:

items: The damage of Gathered Swarm increases to {@dice 2d6}.
If a creature fails its saving throw against being moved by Gathered Swarm, you can also cause the swarm to knock the creature {@condition prone}.
When you are moved by Gathered Swarm, it gives you half cover until the start of your next turn. (+2 to AC and dex saves)

subclassFeature.name: Swarming Dispersal
entries: You can discorporate into your swarm, avoiding danger. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that damage. You vanish into your swarm and then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you, where you reappear with the swarm.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You may expend a 2nd level spell slot or higher to gain another use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Tamer Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Tamer Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Companion
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you summon or find a companion that fights alongside you. The companion is fiercely loyal to you and will listen to your commands even if those commands would harm it. It does not count towards your familiar limit.
The familiar is built based on your runic bond with the creature. Choose a bond that will determine the extra abilities you gain at certain levels of this subclass:
These bonds gain additional abilities at level 7 and level 15 in this subclass.

Your companion build dictates the stats and proficiencies your companion has. Your companion is always a reflection of you and your bond with it. As such its stats are based off of your stats plus or minus any additional stats that each build offers. The stronger you are, the stronger they will be. The smarter you are, the smarter they will be.
Your companion has one attunement slot in which it can attune a set of armor.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Bond
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your companion takes the form of a beast creature and gains the following:

items: Your companion has proficiency in {@skill athletics} and {@skill survival}.
Your companions senses: No additional senses.
Bond language: Your companion understands one language you speak.
{@underline Adrenaline Burst}: Once per short or long rest during your turn, your companion can take an additional action.

entries.name: Primal Bond
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can see everything your companion sees, and your companion cna see everything you can see as long as you are within 150 ft of each other.

entries.name: Bestial Resilience
entries: Starting at 15th level your companion has gained an unnatural hardiness as part of the bond it's made with you and its sense's for danger are better than ever.
Your Companion has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Your companion has advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that your companion can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, your companion can't be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Bond
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your companion takes the form of a fey creature and gains the following:

items: Your companion has proficiency in {@skill nature} and {@skill stealth}.
Your companions senses: No additional senses.
Bond language: Your companion understands {@language sylvan}. You now understand {@language sylvan}.

{@underline Fey trickery}: As a bonus action, your companion may perform the hide action. In addition, you and your companion can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Arcane Bond
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you cast a spell, your companion can deliver that spell as if it had cast the spell. Your companion must be within 100ft of you. (It uses your modifiers and spell save dc's, if the spell has concentration, you must still concentrate on the spell.)

entries.name: Fey Tricks
entries: At 15th level, your companion becomes a master of their innate fey magics. It learns the following spells each of which it can cast only once per long rest using your wisdom modifier as its spellcasting modifier.

Your companion learns: {@spell disguise self|NICKED}, {@spell phantasmal force|NICKED}, {@spell enemies abound|NICKED}, and {@spell greater invisibility|NICKED} which it can cast without expending a spell slot or needing somatic, material, or verbal components. If your companion casts any of these spells on itself, if you are within 30 feet of it when it cast the spell you may gain the benefits of that spell altering it to better suit yourself. (All spells cast are at its lowest levels)
No attack roll can be rolled with advantage when attacking your companion.

subclassFeature.name: Aberration Bond
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your companion takes the form of an aberration and gains the following:

items: Your companion has proficiency in {@skill intimidation}.
Your companions senses: {@sense blindsense} 10ft.
Bond language: Your companion understands {@language deep speech}. You now understand {@language deep speech}.

{@underline Aberrant Guile}: Your aberration gains a pool of three d6's that are Guile Dice. Whenever your companion hits with one of its weapons it may spend a Guile Dice rolling a 1d6 psychic damage and add its damage to the damage total. A creature affected by this dice must make a wisdom saving throw vs your spell save dc. Upon a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} of your companion until the end of your companion's next turn. This pool of dice increases to 4 at 11th level and 5 at 15th level.

entries.name: Primal Bond
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can see everything your companion sees, and your companion cna see everything you can see as long as you are within 150 ft of each other.

entries.name: Aberrant Treachery
entries: Starting at 15th level, your companion can exploit creatures that are {@condition frightened}. It gains advantage on all attacks against creatures with the {@condition frightened} condition (regardless of who it's afraid of).

Your companion learns to cast {@spell hold monster|NICKED} and {@spell fear|NICKED}, which it can cast only once per long rest without expending a spell slot or needing somatic, material, or verbal components. (All spells cast are at its lowest levels)
Creatures immune to the {@condition frightened} condition automatically succeed against {@spell hold monster|NICKED} when your companion casts it.
Your companion has resistance to all force, radiant, and necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Bond
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your companion takes the form of a draconic creature and gains the following:

items: Your companion has proficiency in {@skill arcana}.
Your companions senses: {@sense darkvision} 60 ft
Bond language: Your companion understands {@language draconic}. You now understand {@language draconic}.
{@underline Elemental Resistance}: Your companion gains resistance to an element of your choice that corresponds with its draconic nature.

{@underline Dragon Breath}: Once per short or long rest as your companion's bonus action, your companion can use its magic to exhale destructive energy as a breath weapon. This breath weapon deals {@damage 2d6} elemental damage in a 15 ft cone corresponding to its 'Elemental resistance'. The damage increases to {@dice 3d6}, {@dice 4d6}, and {@dice 5d6} at 7th, 11th, and 15th level respectively.

entries.name: Arcane Bond
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you cast a spell, your companion can deliver that spell as if it had cast the spell. Your companion must be within 100ft of you. (It uses your modifiers and spell save dc's, if the spell has concentration, you must still concentrate on the spell.)

entries.name: Dragon's Prowess
entries: Starting at 15th level, your companion gains immunity to the element corresponding with its 'Elemental resistance'.

In addition, your companion gains a {@sense blindsight} of 30 ft and {@sense darkvision} of 120 ft. Your companion can now see magical essence and can sense the presence of magic within 15 ft of it. If your companion senses magic in this way, it can use its action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and it learns its school of magic, if any and can share this information with you as part of this action.
This sense can penetrate most barriers but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.
Your companion has resistance to all damage from spells.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Bond
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your companion of choice forms a runic bond that cannot be broken. During short rests your companion heals the same amount you do.

During a long rest, you can perform a ritual unique to you and your companion. This ritual takes at least 1 hour in which you pull your companion across or from any plane of existence to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You can perform the same ritual to resurrect your companion from death as though you had cast the spell {@spell true resurrection|NICKED} naming your companion as the target as long as you have your companion's body.
