entries: Your attacks may reach an additional 5 ft. Creatures may still trigger opportunity attacks within you normal range as though you didn't have this additional reach if you so choose.
Creatures trigger opportunity attacks if they move out of your new range.

entries.name: 8 Trigrams Rotation
entries: As a bonus action you may spend one chakra to force each creature within 10 feet of you of your choice to make a dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to an unarmed strike.
Kensei who uses this ability may use one of their one handed weapons damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Drunken Technique
entries: Your attacks may reach an additional 5 ft. Creatures may still trigger opportunity attacks within you normal range as though you didn't have this additional reach if you so choose.
Creatures trigger opportunity attacks if they move out of your new range.

entries.name: Leap to Your Feet
entries: When you're prone, you can stand up by spending 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed. Standing up does not trigger attacks of opportunity.

entries.name: Drunkard's Unpredictability
entries: You lose some of the disadvantages of being prone:

items: The first 25 feet of movement you take each turn while prone does not cost additional movement. This movement takes the form of stumbling, crawling backwards on all fours, rolling and other odd movements that are faster than a normal crawl.
You do not have disadvantage on attack rolls as a result of the condition.
Attack rolls do not gain advantage on you if the attacker is within 5 feet.

entries: (You still trigger other conditions as a result of being knocked prone such as from a creatures ability.)

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Oni's Vigor
entries: When you reduce a creature within 5 ft of you to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Monastic Kata ability modifier + you monk level (minimum 1)

optionalfeature.name: Stillness of Mind
entries: If you start your turn under the effects of the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} or under a spell or ability that charms you, you may end one of those effects. You may do this even if you do not have control over your mind or body. If you end an effect in this way, you lose your action for that turn.
Though you still have and recover you bonus action, reaction, and movement.
If you fail a saving throw, you may spend 1 chakra to reroll that saving throw and take the new result.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Step
entries: You gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. You then have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

optionalfeature.name: Light Arts
entries: When you heal a creature with 0 hitpoints you always restore the maximum amount of hitpoints to that creature.
You learn the {@spell light|NICKED} and {@spell control flames|NICKED} cantrips, this spell uses your Monastic Kata ability modifier for spellcasting
You gain access to any of the Jutsu with the Light Arts requirements.

optionalfeature.name: Unorthodox Technique
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack roll, you may use your reaction to cause that attack to hit one creature of your choice other than the attacker, that you can see within 5 feet of you. You can do this a number of times equal to your monastic kata ability modifier. You recover all of the uses on a short rest.
When you miss with an attack, you may spend 2 chakra to attempt to change that attack to a hit. Roll your unarmed strike damage and add the total to the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Tempered by Steel
entries: As a bonus action you may spend one chakra, if you do you gain resistance to piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Master Death
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 1 chakra point (no action required) to have 1 hit point instead.

optionalfeature.name: Chakra Acceleration
entries: You've honed your awareness and reflexes through mental aptitude and pattern recognition. Once per turn, if you've already taken your reaction, you may spend 1 chakra point to take an additional reaction. You can use only one reaction per triggering effect.

optionalfeature.name: Sage's Teachings
entries: Whenever you activate a stance jutsu, you may select a creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you and spend one chakra. That creature gains the benefits of that stance if they choose to. If they are already in a stance, they lose the effects of that stance and gain the effects of the new one as usual.
Once you grant another creature the effects of a jutsu stance, you may not do so again until you finish a short rest.
If the stance jutsu references a kata stat or unarmed strike the creature may use your stats and unarmed strikes for that stance.

While you are in a jutsu stance and are within 5 ft of another creature in a jutsu stance, you and one of those creatures as though you were under the effects of {@spell warding bond|NICKED} for as long as you remain within 5 feet. You may end this effect on your turn. The creature may also end this effect on their turn (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Wyrm
entries: The power of your draconic spirit now radiates from you, warding your allies or inspiring fear in your enemies. As a bonus action, you can create an aura of draconic power that radiates 10 feet from you for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain one of the following effects of your choice:

items.name: Frightful Presence
entries: When you create this aura and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can choose a creature within the aura. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your chakra save DC or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save

items.name: Resistance
entries: Choose a damage type when you activate this aura: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You and your allies within the aura have resistance to that damage.
Once you create this aura, you can't create it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend 3 chakra points to create it again.

optionalfeature.name: Master of the Arts
entries: You are always under the effects of the {@spell guidance|NICKED} spell. You do not gain guidance sickness.
Choose 2 skills. you gain proficiency in those skills
Choose one instrument or artisan's tool, you gain proficiency in that tool.
Choose one skill or tool you are proficient with. double your proficiency bonus with that skill or tool.

optionalfeature.name: Crane Stance
entries: Bonus Action; 30 second duration

You may perform all your movement as though you have a flying speed. Whenever you stop moving on a turn you lose that flying speed and plummet. You cannot fly higher than 2 X [Your monastic kata ability modifier] with this movement.
You can reset that height by pushing off a sufficient surface such as a wall with sufficient hand holds or even another creature

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Dew of the Universe
entries: 1 Minute; Duration 1 minute

You imbue a liquid that you can drink with chakra. The amount of liquid must be at least the size of a single drop of water. Your careful study and regulation of your body allow you to drink that liquid a gain the following benefits:

items: The dew provides enough nourishment to sustain you for one day.
You gain your unarmed strike damage as temporary hitpoints until your next long rest.
Dew sickness:  You recover all but 1 chakra as part of a short rest.

entries: If another creature drinks this liquid (unless they have this jutsu) they must make a DC 12 (8 if the liquid is a tea) Constitution save. If they succeed, they gain the benefits of the liquid. If they fail, they take damage instead of gaining temporary hp as necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Falling Leaf
entries: 1 Reaction; Duration 1 minute
You and up to one creature of your same size or smaller within 5 ft of you begin to fall slowly. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the jutsu ends.
If the creature lands before the jutsu ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the jutsu ends for that creature.
If you use this jutsu on your turn it costs no chakra and does not consume your reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: No Action Required; until the end of your turn
During this turn your melee attacks reach up to 60ft, you slash with your weapon changing all the damage to fire damage. You gain +1 to attack rolls this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Gong of the Earth
entries: 1 Action

You slap the ground at your feet forcing all creatures within 10 feet of you except you on the ground to make a constitution saving throw. On a failure those creatures take {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and are forced away to 15 feet of you. They take half the damage on a successful save.

If you fell from 30 feet or higher right when you use this ability, double all damage dice rolled. You affect all creatures within 20 feet of you instead, and they will be pushed 25 feet away from you.
If you fell from 45 feet (or equal to), creatures have disadvantage on the save.

This jutsu can be used against a wall or ceiling and affects creatures within 5 feet of that surface, however the jutsu cannot gain bonus effects from you falling distances. (Being thrown does not count as falling)

optionalfeature.name: Healing Hands
entries: 1 Action
You heal a creature within 5ft of you (including yourself) equal to your unarmed strike damage.
You may spend extra chakra on this ability. For each extra chakra you spend on this ability increase its healing by {@dice 1d6}. Increase the additional healing dice to {@dice 1d8} at 11th level
You cannot spend more that half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) additional chakra on this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Leg Sweep
entries: 1 Action

You take the {@action attack} action. The first weapon attack or unarmed strike you make against each different creature this turn forces that creature to make a strength saving throw if that attack hits them. Upon a failed saving throw the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Mantis Stance
entries: 30 second duration
During your turn you have +5 AC.

When you roll damage for a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may roll the weapon damage twice and take the higher of the two rolls. (this does not apply to any other dice that may be added to the roll)
When you critically strike with an attack, double the damage from your ability modifier if it was added to the attack, as well.

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Ox Stance
entries: Bonus Action; 30 second duration
You gain +2 Armor class.

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Spirit
entries: 1 Bonus Action
You may cast the spell {@spell sanctuary|NICKED} without verbal, somatic, or material components on a creature within 5ft (including you).

optionalfeature.name: Rising Sun Kick
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may deal additional damage on that attack equal to your monastic kata ability modifier in the form of a kick. Then you may “Vault” the creature. You may use this jutsu only once per turn, and only during your turn.

If you choose to 'Vault' over them, you may move around, over, or under them to the opposite side of the creature passing through their space given that there is a (reasonably) large enough gap above them, to their sides, or between their legs. This movement does not consume movement as part of your turn and does not trigger attacks of opportunity. You cannot use this jutsu more than once each turn.

optionalfeature.name: Water Whip
entries: 1 Action

You attempt to pull a creature within 45 feet closer to you. That creature must make a strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} and be pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line toward you until the creature ends within 5 ft of you.
A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes 1/2 damage and is not pulled.

optionalfeature.name: Bending Reed Stance
entries: 1 Action; 30 Seconds

You begin to react so fast that you gain the benefits of the {@condition dodge} condition. You must focus on this stance as though you were focusing on a spell. You automatically succeed on concentration checks until the start of your next turn to maintain this stance the turn you activate it.
You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked unconscious or paralyzed, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Khan
entries: 1 Action
You can cast {@spell silence|NICKED} without Verbal, Somatic, or Material components. The duration of the spell is 5 minutes
The spell moves centered on you and the spells radius is reduced to within 5ft of you.

The spell gives a slight shadow in the area it affects. This effect doesn't affect a creature's vision. It does allow for effects that depend on shadows, such as the monk's shadow step feature. Due to this shadow, a creature is aware of the exact distance this spell reaches given sufficient lighting.
This spell is dispersed by effects such as the {@spell daylight|NICKED} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Path
entries: 1 Action
You can cast {@spell pass without trace|NICKED} without Verbal, Somatic, or Material components.
If you affect only yourself with this spell, you do not need to concentrate on this spell to maintain its effects.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: 1 Action
You can cast {@spell darkness|NICKED} without Verbal, Somatic, or Material components.

optionalfeature.name: Step of the Wind
entries: 1 Bonus Action
You become {@condition invisible}, gain a flying speed, and move up to that speed as part of this bonus action.
After you finish this movement, you lose the invisibility and flying speed.

This movement is so rapid that creatures that can see through illusions, Invisibility, or perceive you with other senses have a hard time tracking this movement and have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Moon
entries: 1 Action
You can cast {@spell calm emotions|NICKED} without Verbal, Somatic, or Material components, but it only affects one creature of your choice within range. That creature must be able to hear you.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Sun
entries: When you make a {@skill persuasion}, {@skill performance}, or {@skill intimidation} check, after you roll but before you know the outcome, you may roll your unarmed strike damage and add it to the total. You may use this ability only once on an ability check, per ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Gate of Body (First Gate)
entries: 1 Action
You open up your body to the universe and attempt to bend it to you will. Once you open the first gate, you cannot use a jutsu that opens the first gate again until you finish a long rest.
You heal for {@dice 1d4} for each monk level.

entries.name: Gate
entries: When you have opened the last of all three gates (the first, second, and third gate) your monastic kata ability score increases to 30 for 10 minutes. After the effect wears off you suffer one level of exhaustion, and your monastic kata ability score becomes 10 until you finish a short or long rest (Shugoki may instead increase their strength score instead).
When the ability finishes, your strength becomes 10 until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp the Humanoid Spirit
entries: 1 Action; 1 Minute Duration

You cast {@spell hold person|NICKED} without verbal or material components on a creature within 5 ft of you. The somatic component of this spell is you hitting a pressure point of the creature. (you must still concentrate on the spell)
You may upcast the spell for two additional Chakra per level (additional creatures must still be within 5 ft of you).

optionalfeature.name: Oni Stance
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 30 Second Duration

You gain the benefits of the enlarge half of the {@spell enlarge/reduce|NICKED} spell (no concentration required). While under the effects of this stance, a spectral Oni mask adorns your face. You may end its effects as a bonus action.
Whenever this jutsu's effects would end you may extend this duration for the cost of 1 chakra. No action required.

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Clone
entries: 1 Action; 1 Hour Duration
You summon an almost perfect copy of yourself within 5 feet and transfer your consciousness to it. You can see through its eyes, use its senses, and speak through its mouth.
While the clone is active, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses. You cannot perform actions or attacks through this clone though you can move and act like you can.

You cannot interact with objects (or creatures) as you are made out of shadow. You cannot contort, jump, or move in a way that you could not normally as if you were physically present. A creature can make an {@skill investigation} check against your monastic kata DC to determine that this copy is a manifestation of shadows. The shadow clone has hitpoints equal to your monk level and all the same stats, senses, walking speed, and armor class you do.

Creatures that come into physical contact with the copy can reveal that it is a manifestation of shadow. This jutsu is treated as though it was an effect from an illusion spell of second level for all spells and abilities.
You may end the effects of this jutsu as an action in which your senses return to you, the copy dissipates with a minor effect of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Shuriken Barrage
entries: 1 Action

You summon a shadow shuriken that duplicates itself as it flies spreading out in a 60ft-cone creating a deadly hail of blades. Each creature in that cone takes {@damage 3d8} piercing damage. (Like with all cones; this effect is blocked by full cover)
This jutsu does no damage to structures.
Creatures with at least half cover, a feature such as evasion, or a creature with advantage on dexterity saving throws may make a Dexterity save to take half damage.
The shuriken disappear in a puff of black smoke after they land leaving no traces except wounds.

optionalfeature.name: Third Eye of Tetsuo
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 1 Hour Duration
A third astral eye appears in the center of your forehead for the duration of the jutsu. While this jutsu is active you gain the following benefits.

items: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to 120 feet.
You cannot be {@condition blinded} (though if you are, your vision comes from the center of your forehead for the effects duration).
You gain the benefits of the {@spell see invisibility|NICKED} spell.
For the purposes of spell effects and magical abilities, such as those found on the medusa, you can avert your eyes by closing them, but you do not lose vision or your ability to see.

optionalfeature.name: Bend the Light
entries: 1 Action (performed not in magical darkness); 1 Hour Duration
You bend the light into a celestial creature that servers you, you cast {@spell summon beast|NICKED} without verbal, somatic, or material components.
The summoned creature takes the form of a celestial instead of a beast and gives off a small amount of dim light equal to your kata movement speed bonus. (you must still concentrate on the spell)
While you are within the light given off by this celestial, you have advantage on concentration checks.
You may upcast this spell for an additional chakra per level. *You cannot spend more than half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) of additional chakra to upcast it.

optionalfeature.name: Jin-Se Lance
entries: 1 Action; 1 Round Duration

Make an unarmed strike against a creature against a creature (a willing creature may choose to have this attack hit them). You may forgo the damage that the unarmed strike would deal to a creature if you choose.

If the attack hits, that creature must make a charisma saving throw (a willing creature may choose to fail). Upon a failure they are forced into a small rift that opens behind them hurling them through the planes of the heavens. They do not return until the start of your next turn.
The creature returns to the spot they just left or in the nearest open space of the creature's choice.
You may have non-celestial creatures take damage equal to your monk level as radiant damage.
Once an unwilling creature is successfully affected by this jutsu, they cannot be affected by it again for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Tree of Life Stance
entries: 1 Action; 30 Second Duration

You assume a life-giving stance that radiates energy. When you activate this jutsu and at the start of each of your turns, roll your unarmed strike damage. You heal up to a number of creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you equal to your proficiency bonus for the amount of unarmed strike damage rolled.
If you heal a creature at 0 hitpoints, double the amount of healing that creature receives.
You do not drop this stance if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} from being at 0 hitpoints, however this stance will only heal you at the start of your turn while you are at 0 hitpoints.
You can only active this stance once, after which you need to finish a short or long rest to assume the stance again.

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Breath Control
entries: When you fail an {@skill acrobatics} or {@skill athletics} check, you may reroll the d20 and take the higher of the rolls possibly changing the outcome. You may use this ability multiple times on the same attempt. If the roll fails, each subsequent time you use this jutsu on an ability check increase the chakra cost of this effect by 1 stacking up to a maximum of 4 chakra (in total).

optionalfeature.name: Chakra Control: Water
entries: 1 Action; Until next short or long rest
You gain the benefits of the {@spell water walk|NICKED} spell (This jutsu only affects you). You may end the effect as a bonus action.
You learn the {@spell water walk|NICKED} and {@spell water breathing|NICKED} spells; you may cast these spells only as a ritual.

optionalfeature.name: Drain Qi
entries: 1 Action; 1 Minute Duration

You may cast {@spell slow|NICKED} on all creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you without verbal or material components. You must be able to touch the creature in order to cast this spell in this way. (you must still concentrate on the spell)
Then you make an unarmed strike against each of those creatures, you only roll one attack roll and one damage roll and apply those rolls accordingly to each affected creature.

optionalfeature.name: Maramusa's Dividing Wind
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 12 Seconds (2 rounds)

You bring your hands together and make a slicing motion in a direction summoning a great dividing wind in a 5 foot wide, 10 foot tall, line that stretches out 30 feet originating from you. For each creature in that line, they must make a strength saving throw or be shoved 5 feet to the side (you choose which side for each creature).

This wind remains in that space for 12 seconds (2 rounds- end of your 2nd turn). Creatures that try to enter the space occupied by the wind must make a strength saving throw to traverse it. They may only attempt to save against this ability once per turn. If they succeed, the creature treats the spaces as rough terrain.

Projectiles such as darts, arrows of normal size, thrown weapons without the heavy property and cantrips that produce projectiles are automatically deflected and shoot towards the ground if they try to pass through the spaces or are fired through the spaces occupied by the wind.

Large creatures do not need to make a strength save but still treat the terrain as rough terrain. Huge or larger creatures are unaffected by this wind (though their projectiles my still be deflected if they are small enough).

optionalfeature.name: Phoenix Dive
entries: 1 Action
You gain a temporary flying speed and launch in a straight line carried by wings of flame and light to a point within 80 feet of you that you can see when you activate this jutsu.

When you reach your destination, you cause a blast of fire and light around you forcing all other creatures in a 20 foot radius (centered on you) to make a dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} fire damage and {@damage 4d6} radiant damage, half as much on a successful save. The blast fire and light spread around corners and ignites flammable objects in the area that are not being worn or carried.
After you arrive at the destination, you lose your flying speed granted by this jutsu.

This jutsu does not consume movement on your turn and does not trigger opportunity attacks. You may fly around or over other creatures to reach your destination and may move thorough other creatures occupied spaces provided there is enough (reasonable) space to do so.

This jutsu produces sufficient enough noise to be heard as far as 500 feet away. Your body causes a howling wind as it flies through the air until the final destination. The blast at your destination takes the form of your choice of a screaming phoenix, roar of flames, or war cry.

optionalfeature.name: Restore the Body
entries: 1 Action; Until the creature's next short or long rest
You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.
Additionally you grant that creature temp hitpoints equal to a roll of your unarmed strike damage.
The next time the creature takes damage, they treat that damage as though they had resistances to it.
This jutsu counts as the healing hands jutsu for all abilities and features.

optionalfeature.name: Spreading Mists of the Shining Sea
entries: 1 Action

You breathe out a mist of healing water that bolsters your allies and yourself with rejuvenating properties. You heal all creatures (of your choice) within 60 ft of you (including yourself) equal to your unarmed strike damage.
This jutsu counts as the healing hands jutsu for all abilities and features.

optionalfeature.name: Umbral Shroud
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 1 Minute Duration
You may cast {@spell spirit shroud|NICKED} without verbal or somatic components. (you must still concentrate on the spell)

optionalfeature.name: Gate of Mind (Second Gate)
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 30 Second Duration (5 rounds)
You open up your mind to the universe and attempt to bend it to you will. Once you open the second gate you cannot use a jutsu that opens the second gate again until you finish a long rest.

You gain the ability to see multiple possible outcomes for a very short time. Roll 3 d20's and log the results of each of those d20. For the duration of the ability, you may substitute any roll you make that rolls a d20 with one of the results you rolled on the d20. Once a result has been used, it cannot be used again for the duration of the ability.

entries.name: Gate
entries: When you have opened the last of all three gates (the first, second, and third gate) your monastic kata ability score increases to 30 for 10 minutes. After the effect wears off you suffer one level of exhaustion, and your monastic kata ability score becomes 10 until you finish a short or long rest (Shugoki may instead increase their strength score instead).
When the ability finishes, your strength becomes 10 until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Guardian of the Monastery
entries: 1 Action; 1 Hour Duration

You may cast {@spell summon construct|NICKED}. (you must still concentrate on the spell) Rather than its normal components, you need a monastery bell worth 400gp to summon this construct, which you strike causing it to ring. You may only select stone material in which it takes the form of a terracotta warrior.
If you summon the creature within a monastery that you are familiar with; the spell does not require concentration.
You may upcast this spell for an additional chakra per level.
You cannot spend more than half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) of additional chakra to upcast it.

optionalfeature.name: Hone the Weapon
entries: 1 Action; Until your next short or long rest
You touch a weapon within 5 feet of you or use it to enhance your unarmed strikes. You spend 1 to 3 chakra to grant a bonus to attack rolls equal to the number of chakra spent.
The weapon Improves its based on the amount of Chakra spent and its innate bonuses. For each chakra spent, it increases the weapons attack rolls based on the criteria below:

items: A weapon without bonuses to their attack roll gain up to a +3 increase to its attack rolls based on the amount of chakra spent: +1 if you spent 1 chakra, +2 if you spent 2 chakra, and +3 if you spent 3 chakra.
A weapon with a +1 enchantment: requires 2 chakra to give it a +1 to its attack rolls or 3 chakra to give it a +2 to its attack rolls. (stacking with it natural increased to hit)
A weapon with a +2 enchantment: Requires 3 chakra to give it a +1 to its attack rolls. (stacking with it natural increased to hit)

entries: A weapon with a +3 or greater enchantment cannot be enhanced. If a weapon enhances its chances to hit with dice or based off additional ability modifiers or any other type of increase, it cannot be enhanced.

optionalfeature.name: Land of Darkness Stance
entries: On your turn; 1 Minute Duration

You radiate a shadow of dim light in a 30ft radius around you, and your eyes become blank voids that pour forth shadows as though they were tears. This shadow spreads around corners and through cracks as small as one inch wide but is blocked by total cover.
While in the shadow you and friendly creatures of your choice up to your proficiency bonus become part of that shadow (chosen when you activate the stance).
Affected creatures gain the following benefits:

items: Vision is not affected by dim light and darkness. They can see as though they were in bright light.

During the creature's turn, they can become temporarily incorporeal and are able to move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. They must end their turn in a space that could fit them.
Creatures do not have disadvantage on stealth rolls as a result of their armor.
Creatures have a walking speed equal to your walking speed and your unfaltering step feature.

entries: These effects linger on a creature until it ends its turn outside of the shadow. A creature can regain these effects by ending their turn within the radius of your shadow.

This shadow cannot enter into magical light and is overpowered by it. If a creature would become affected by a spell such as {@spell daylight|NICKED}, they lose all of the bonuses it provides and become corporeal. If a creature would become corporeal in a space, they could not fit they are shunted back to the last available space that they moved from that they could fit and take {@dice 2d10} force damage.
You may extend the duration of this stance when it is about to end by 1 minute for 1 chakra.

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Light of the Heavens
entries: 1 Action; 1 Minute Duration

Light floods out from you in all directions creating a beacon of light that dispels even magical darkness of 5th level or lower. The bright light reaches as far as 40 feet from you with 20ft of dim light beyond that.

Within 5 feet of you purging flames burn. Creatures other than you that start their turn in this purging fire are engulfed by the burning light energy searing it. The creature must make a constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} radiant and 2d10 fire damage, half as much on a successful one.

Creatures with darkvision, the ability to see in magical darkness, or shape changer creatures are stunned the first time they fail the saving throw against the effect, after which they become immune to the stun effect of this ability for the next 24 hours.
You must concentrate on this effect as though you were concentrating on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Contact Other Plane
entries: 1 Minute Ritual; 1 Minute Duration

You cast {@spell contact other plane|NICKED}. You do this as part of a meditation which requires material components of incense and somatic components of a meditative stance rather than the normal only verbal components required of the spell.
You cannot use this jutsu again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gate of Spirit (3rd Gate)
entries: 1 Reaction; 1 Round
You open up your spirit to the universe and attempt to bend it to you will. Once you open the third gate you cannot use a jutsu that opens the third gate again until you finish a long rest.

Whenever you would take damage from a spell, effect, or attack, or be forced to make a saving throw you may use your reaction to phase out of existence for 1 round avoiding the effect. You cannot do this in an area that prevents or nullifies teleportation. You reappear at the start of your next turn in the space you disappeared from. If the space is now occupied, you appear in the closest unoccupied space in any direction, if there are multiple that are of equal distance you select which space you appear in. (you can reappear in the air or in another form of danger however)

entries.name: Gate
entries: When you have opened the last of all three gates (the first, second, and third gate) your monastic kata ability score increases to 30 for 10 minutes. After the effect wears off you suffer one level of exhaustion, and your monastic kata ability score becomes 10 until you finish a short or long rest (Shugoki may instead increase their strength score instead).
When the ability finishes, your strength becomes 10 until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp the Monster's Spirit
entries: 1 Action; 1 Minute Duration

You cast {@spell hold monster|NICKED} without Verbal or Material components on a creature within 5 ft of you. The somatic component of this spell is you hitting a pressure point of the creature. (you must still concentrate on the spell)
You may upcast the spell for two additional Chakra per level (additional creatures must still be within 5 ft of you).

optionalfeature.name: Mislead
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 1 Minute Duration

You cast {@spell mislead|NICKED} without Verbal or Material components on a creature within 5 ft of you. The somatic component of this spell is you hitting a pressure point of the creature. (you must still concentrate on the spell)

optionalfeature.name: Roar of the Ogre
entries: 1 Action; 30 second Duration (5 rounds)

Choose a creature within 80 feet of you that you can see. You teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the chosen creature and let out a bestial howl. The creature must make a wisdom save or become {@condition frightened} of you. For the duration of this jutsu, you have advantage on all attacks and {@skill intimidation} and {@skill athletics} checks against that creature if it failed the save.
Then you may make 3 melee attacks with your weapon or unarmed strikes against the chosen creature.

While the creature remains {@condition frightened} of you; you may activate this jutsu again as an action to teleport within 5 feet of that creature. When you do, you may make 3 melee attacks with your weapon or unarmed strikes against that creature.
The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Tiger Stance
entries: No Action Required; 30 second Duration (5 rounds)
When the {@action attack} action on your turn, you may make an additional unarmed strike (no action required). You may use this effect only once per turn.

You may only have one chakra stance active at any time. If you activate a new one end the effect of the old one. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or {@condition paralyzed}, you lose this stance.

optionalfeature.name: Volley of Weapons
entries: 1 Action

You throw a nonmagical weapon which this jutsu consumes. That weapon turns into hundreds of duplicates which either fall from above or fly in a straight line (your choice). Choose one of the following:

items: Cone: this weapon becomes a flurry of weapons in a cone up to 100 feet.
Volley: this weapon becomes a volley of weapons that rain from above on each creature within a 40 foot radius, 20 foot high cylinder.

entries: Creatures within the area must make a dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d8} damage of the same type as the weapon you threw, half as much on a save.
Additionally, the area becomes rough terrain until the start of your next turn, due to all the protruding weapons.
After each projectile weapon lands, it disappears in a gray puff of smoke after 1 round. (or in shadow if you have shadow arts or in a small burst of light if you have light as your choice)

optionalfeature.name: Wall of Light
entries: 1 Bonus Action; 10 Minute Duration
You may cast {@spell wall of light|NICKED} without verbal, somatic, or material components. (you must still concentrate on the spell)

optionalfeature.name: Truesight
entries: You have truesight with a range of 120 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill investigation}.
You have advantage on all wisdom {@skill survival} checks that you use to track humanoids and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on humanoids.
Creatures hit by your Ensnaring Strike have disadvantage on the save

optionalfeature.name: Keeper of the Veil
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill arcana}.
You have advantage on all wisdom {@skill survival} checks that you use to track fey creatures and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on fey creatures.
You gain the {@spell true strike|NICKED} cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Knight Ranger
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill history}.
You have advantage on all wisdom {@skill survival} checks you use to track dragons and monstrosities and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on dragons and monstrosities.
You gain proficiency in heavy armor.

optionalfeature.name: Ranger General
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill nature}.
You have advantage on all wisdom {@skill survival} checks you use to track plants and plant creatures and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on plants and plant creatures.
You gain the {@spell druidcraft|NICKED} cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Sanctified Stalker
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill religion}.
You have advantage on all wisdom {@skill survival} checks you use to track celestials and fiends and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on celestials and fiends.

You may cast {@spell protection from evil and good|NICKED} once per long rest as a bonus action without expending a spell slot targeting yourself (wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for this spell).
This spell is always prepared for you and does not count against the number of spells you have prepared.

optionalfeature.name: Big Game Hunter
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill athletics}.
You have advantage on all wisdom {@skill survival} checks you use to track beasts and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on beasts.
While concentrating on a ranger spell, if you would be forced to make a concentration check to maintain that spell of DC 10 or lower, you automatically succeed on that check.

optionalfeature.name: Ranger of the Dire Hour
entries: Gain proficiency in {@skill religion} and {@skill perception}.
You have advantage on all {@skill survival} checks you use to track aberrations and undead and all intelligence {@skill history} checks to recall information on aberrations and undead.

optionalfeature.name: Arctic
entries: You gain resistance to Cold Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Coast
entries: You gain resistance to Lightning Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Desert
entries: You gain resistance to Fire Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Forest
entries: You gain resistance to Acid Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Grassland
entries: You gain resistance to Fire Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain
entries: You gain resistance to Cold Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Swamp
entries: You gain resistance to Poison Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Underdark
entries: You gain resistance to Psychic Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Gain a Feat
entries: You gain a feat.

optionalfeature.name: TremorSense
entries: You gain tremorsense 15 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Double Concentration
entries: You can concentrate on 2 ranger spells at once.

optionalfeature.name: +Wis to Hit on Miss(Once Per Turn)
entries: Once per turn when you miss and attack you may add your wisdom modifier to the attack possibly turning a miss into a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Free Dash Per Minute
entries: You can take {@action dash} action without needing to use an action to do so once per minute.

optionalfeature.name: +Str or +Dex
entries: Your dexterity or strength increases by 2, this increase can increase your stat above 20.

optionalfeature.name: Unseen Attacker Crit+
entries: While you are an unseen attacker you critically strike on a 19-20.

optionalfeature.name: Ignore Opportunity
entries: You do not provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Attack Advantage on Trackable Creatures
entries: You have advantage on all attack rolls against creatures that you could track at advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Determine Resistances
entries: As a bonus action you can determine all of a creature's resistances and immunities of a creature you can see that is not immune to divination.

optionalfeature.name: Escape Artist
entries: You can escape all restraints magical or mundane using 10 ft of movement. ({@condition restrained} condition)

optionalfeature.name: Saving Throw Expertise
entries: Double your proficiency bonus to a saving throw of your choice that you are proficient in.

optionalfeature.name: +Wis to Damage (Once Per Turn)
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee attack you may add your wisdom modifier to that attack's damage.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from your race, its range increases by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Acrobatics
entries: {@skill acrobatics}

optionalfeature.name: Animal Handling
entries: {@skill animal handling}

optionalfeature.name: Arcana
entries: {@skill arcana}

optionalfeature.name: Athletics
entries: {@skill athletics}

optionalfeature.name: Deception
entries: {@skill deception}

optionalfeature.name: History
entries: {@skill history}

optionalfeature.name: Insight
entries: {@skill insight}

optionalfeature.name: Intimidation
entries: {@skill intimidation}

optionalfeature.name: Investigation
entries: {@skill investigation}

optionalfeature.name: Medicine
entries: {@skill medicine}

optionalfeature.name: Nature
entries: {@skill nature}

optionalfeature.name: Perception
entries: {@skill perception}

optionalfeature.name: Performance
entries: {@skill performance}

optionalfeature.name: Persuasion
entries: {@skill persuasion}

optionalfeature.name: Religion
entries: {@skill religion}

optionalfeature.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: {@skill sleight of hand}

optionalfeature.name: Stealth
entries: {@skill stealth}

optionalfeature.name: Survival
entries: {@skill survival}

optionalfeature.name: Steady Aim
entries: As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on your next ranged attack roll on the current turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 ft until the end of the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mastermind
entries: As a bonus action, you can yous the {@action help} action. When you use the {@action help} action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 ft of you, rather than within 5 ft of you, if the target can see or hear you.

optionalfeature.name: One With Shadows
entries: You can try to {@action hide} when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding. Creatures with {@sense darkvision} have the same ability to see you when hiding in dim light or darkness as though they didn't have the ability.
Creatures who can see in magical darkness are immune to this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Gang Up
entries: As a bonus action, you gain advantage on your next melee attack on a creature that is within 5 ft of another creature hostile to it but is not within 5 ft of a creature that is friendly to it.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Dodge
entries: As a bonus action, select one creature that you can see. You gain the effects of the {@condition dodge} against all attacks, spells, and mundane and magical effects from that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your proficiency bonus. Those creatures are unaffected by the spell.
You can use Careful Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell.
When you cast a spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 sorcery point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.
You can use Distant Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 2 sorcery points to add an additional damage dice of the same type as the damage dice would be rolled when determining damage from the spell, then roll two sets of damage dice for the spell. You then select which set of dice you would like to use.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Esoteric Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals force, necrotic, psychic, or radiant damage, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change the spell's damage to another type from the list above.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Jaunt Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that teleports a creature, you may spend two sorcery points. If you do, you can teleport one additional willing creature within 5 feet of you. Additional creatures teleport to the same location as one of the creatures teleported with the spell within 5 feet of that creature in an unoccupied space.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has concentration, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level (one for cantrips) to automatically succeed on Constitution saving throws to maintain that spell for the duration.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you cast a cantrip spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 1 sorcery point to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

When you cast a leveled spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Imparted Spell
entries: When you use a spell slot to cast a spell with a range of self, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to the spell's level to change the spell's casting range to touch. You still suffer all the drawbacks of casting the spell and must maintain its concentration if there is concentration.
Cantrips cost 1 sorcery point to cast with this Metamagic.
If the spell requires you to make an attack roll as part of its effect, then the creature you're casting this on must use their reaction to make that attack roll.

If a spell would be able to trigger as a reaction with target fulfilling the conditions of the reaction, you may cast the spell as a reaction transferring the effect to the creature. The creature must use their reaction to activate the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Nonlethal Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you can spend 1 sorcery point to knock the creature out, rendering it {@condition unconscious}, rather than deal a killing blow. If your spell would deal a killing blow to multiple creatures, you spend 1 sorcery point for every two creatures.
If the spell you cast was a cantrip, you may use this effect without spending a sorcery point.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 2 sorcery points to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.
You can only use Seeking Spell once per spell.

optionalfeature.name: Siphoning Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level (minimum 2) to heal yourself by an amount equal to half the damage dealt to a single target, rounded down. You can use this effect before you roll damage. You cannot regain hitpoints more than half of the total damage rolled on the damage dice.
(you would regain less from a creature resistant to the attack but you would not gain double the hp if a creature is vulnerable)

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components.

optionalfeature.name: Transmuted Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).
To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level.
For example, {@spell magic missile|NICKED} and {@spell omni-ray X|NICKED} aren't eligible, but {@spell ray of frost|NICKED} and {@spell chromatic orb|NICKED} are.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Cantrip
entries: When you cast a cantrip that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You gain acid resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Resistance
entries: You gain lightning resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You gain fire resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You gain poison resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You gain cold resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision 60 ft
entries: You gain darkvision out to 60 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision 120 ft
entries: You gain darkvision out to 120 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade

entries.name: Create Pact Weapon
entries: You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see the Weapons section for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Additionally, whenever you {@action attack} with the bonded weapon, you may use your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls, instead of using Strength or Dexterity.

Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

entries.name: Bind Pact Weapon
entries: You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks. You can only bind a weapon in this way of a same kind that you could summon with the create pact weapon feature above.
Your class gains the Martial tag for the purposes of feats and multiclassing leveling in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Chained
entries: Your patron reveals to you that you are a beast caged; they allow you to use your chains in their service. Your body becomes scrawled with chains (as a tattoo, birthmark, or scars) up to your neck if it was not already. These chains can manifest into ethereal bonds that extend all the way out to 10ft. These chains act as an extension of your unarmed strike attacks allowing you to make an unarmed strike weapon attack up to 10 ft.

Additionally, you may use your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls, instead of using Strength. Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purposes of overcoming magical resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. You can roll a {@dice 1d6} in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike.
When you gain this pact feature, you {@bold may} use wisdom in place of all spellcasting or features granted or referenced by your warlock class (including the above feature).

entries.name: Call your Shade
entries: You learn {@spell find familiar|NICKED} which takes the form of a small shadow animal in the form of your choice but has the same stat block regardless of form ({{@creature Chained Shadow|NICKED|shadow}).
Your class gains the Martial tag for the purposes of feats and multiclassing and leveling in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three cantrips from any class's spell list (the three needn't be from the same list). While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. If they don't appear on the warlock spell list, they are nonetheless warlock spells for you.
When you gain this pact feature, you {@bold may} use intelligence in place of all spellcasting or features granted or referenced by your warlock class.

If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Your patron gives you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need is great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a d4 to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1 hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast|NICKED}, add your Charisma modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Shadows
entries: You can cast {@spell mage armor|NICKED} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
This effect lasts until you dismiss it as a bonus action instead of its usual duration.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant Step
entries: You can cast {@spell levitate|NICKED} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Moon
entries: You no longer need to sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity, such as reading your Book of Shadows and keeping watch.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.
The effects of this spell last until you dismiss it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Persuasion} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Bewitching Whispers
entries: You can cast {@spell compulsion|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bond of the Talisman
entries: While someone else is wearing your talisman, you can use your action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your talisman can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you. The teleportation can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
entries: You can now inscribe magical rituals in your Book of Shadows. Choose two {@filter 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list|spells|Components & Miscellaneous=ritual|level=1|source=NICKED}. The spells needn't be from the same spell list. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Shadows in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.

On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Shadows. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.

optionalfeature.name: Chains of Carceri
entries: You slam your ethereal chains together and attempt to bind a creature of otherworldly nature

You can cast {@spell hold monster|NICKED} at will—targeting a celestial, fiend, or elemental—without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover. It lasts until you're {@condition incapacitated} or you dismiss it as a bonus action.

The aura grants you advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks but disadvantage on all other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes poison damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0 damage).
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Devil's Sight
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dreadful Word
entries: You can cast {@spell confusion|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Armaments
entries: You gain proficiency with medium armor and shields.

You can use your action to create a set pact armor you are proficient with. You can choose the form that this pact armor takes each time you create it, you may select {@item leather armor}, {@item chain shirt} armor, or {@item chainmail} armor (if you are proficient in heavy armor). This armor counts as magical.
Additionally, you may bind and create a shield in the same way.

Your pact armaments disappear if they are more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the armor (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic armor and one magic shield into your pact armaments by performing a special ritual while you hold them. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the armor and shield, shunting them into an extradimensional space, and they appear whenever you create your pact armaments thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient armor or shields in this way. The armaments ceases being your pact armaments if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different armor or shield, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to them. The armaments appear at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.
When you summon the armaments as an action, they appear already equipped if able.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your {@status concentration} on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Smite
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to the target, plus another {@damage 1d8} per level of the spell slot, and you can knock the target {@condition prone} if it is Huge or smaller.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Spear
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast|NICKED}, its range is 300 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Rune Keeper
entries: You can read all writing.

optionalfeature.name: Far Scribe
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your proficiency bonus.

You can cast the {@spell sending|NICKED} spell, targeting a creature whose name is on the page, without using a spell slot and without using material components. To do so, you must write the message on the page. The target hears the message in their mind, and if the target replies, their message appears on the page, rather than in your mind. The writing disappears after 1 minute.
As an action, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Vigor
entries: You can cast {@spell false life|NICKED} on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components. You always roll max temporary hitpoints when you cast the spell.
You add {@spell false life|NICKED} to your spell list, and it counts as a warlock spell for you but does not count against the max number of spells known.
At 10th level in warlock, when you cast the spell at will, count it as though it was a 2nd level spell in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of Two Minds
entries: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own surroundings.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Gaze
entries: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have {@sense darkvision} if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts for 1 minute or until your {@status concentration} ends (as if you were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can also cast {@spell water breathing|NICKED} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Ever-Living Ones
entries: Whenever you regain hit points, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.
When you take a short rest, recover all of your hitpoints.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Protectors
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your proficiency bonus.

When any creature whose name is on the page is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, the creature magically drops to 1 hit point instead. Once this magic is triggered, no creature can benefit from it until you finish a long rest.
As an action, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of Hadar
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast|NICKED}, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

Finally, the weapon you conjure can be a {@item shortbow|phb}, {@item longbow|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, or {@item heavy crossbow|phb}. (if your setting includes odd weapons such as firearms, katana, or other unique weapons you may also conjure a base form of them)

If the weapon requires ammunition to work, it conjures its own ammunition (no action required). This conjured ammunition disappears after 1 minute. To even the simplest of beasts, this conjured ammunition appears to magical, semi-translucent and upon even the most basic inspection Investigation DC: 2 would show that it would disappear in one minute.

If you conjure or bind a one-handed weapon with the light property, you may bind a second weapon with the same one handed and light properties to your pact of the blade. If you would summon a weapon using that feature, you summon both weapons as part of that feature (single action).

optionalfeature.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: As a bonus action, you can bind more of your will to your patron gaining on of the following effects until your next long rest:

items: Your movement speed increases by 10 ft.
You gain resistance to all ranged weapon attacks and ranged cantrips.
You gain the ability to {@action disengage} as a bonus action. You gain the effects of the {@action disengage} action on the turn you activate this ability.
Whenever you hit a creature with your unarmed strike, you can use your chains to shove the creature 5 ft away or closer to you.

entries: Once you activate this effect you cannot activate it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Lance of Lethargy
entries: Once on each of your turns per creature, when you hit a creature with your {@spell eldritch blast|NICKED}, you can reduce that creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lifedrinker
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon or your manifested chains, the creature takes extra necrotic, radiant, or psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). You choose the damage type when you gain this invocation and may change the damage type anytime you gain a level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Maddening Hex
entries: As a bonus action, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your {@spell hex|NICKED} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hex Keeper's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. When you do so, you deal psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The psychic damage equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage). To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: You can cast {@spell disguise self|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.
This effect lasts until you become unconscious or you dismiss it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Myriad Forms
entries: You can cast {@spell alter self|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Minions of Chaos
entries: You can cast {@spell conjure elemental|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mire the Mind
entries: You can cast {@spell slow|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Misty Visions
entries: You can cast {@spell silent image|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: One with Shadows
entries: When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become {@condition invisible} until you move or take an action or a reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Leap
entries: You can cast {@spell jump|NICKED} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Talisman
entries: The wearer of the talisman gains the effects of the {@spell bless|NICKED} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Rebuke of the Talisman
entries: When the wearer of your talisman is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to your proficiency bonus and push it up to 10 feet away from the talisman's wearer.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Hex
entries: Your curse creates a temporary bond between you and your target. As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your {@spell hex|NICKED} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hex Keeper's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

optionalfeature.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When you hit a creature with {@spell eldritch blast|NICKED}, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Sculptor of Flesh
entries: You can cast {@spell polymorph|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of Shadow
entries: You can cast {@spell invisibility|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Sign of Ill Omen
entries: You can cast {@spell bestow curse|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Thief of Five Fates
entries: You can cast {@spell bane|NICKED} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tomb of Levistus
entries: As a reaction when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain 10 temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. Immediately after you take the damage, you gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed is reduced to 0, and you are {@condition incapacitated}. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, all end when the ice melts.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Trickster's Escape
entries: You can cast {@spell freedom of movement|NICKED} once on yourself without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Servitude
entries: You can cast {@spell summon undead|NICKED} without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Distant Realms
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Chain Master
entries: When you cast {@spell find familiar|NICKED}, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.
Additionally, when you take the {@action attack} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to make one attack with its reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Whispers of the Grave
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with dead|NICKED} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Witch Sight
entries: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you and within line of sight.

optionalfeature.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive
entries: You gain +1 to armor class.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

If you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, and are not within 5 feet of any other creature, your first attack of opportunity on that creature each turn does not cost you your reaction (or require you to have one available).
Note: You may still only take one attack of opportunity each time the attack of opportunity triggers.

optionalfeature.name: Dyad Handed
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon, using two hands to wield that weapon (or one hand while your other hand does not hold a shield or another weapon), and that weapon does not have the heavy property, you gain a +1 to hit and a +1 to damage with that weapon.
You may use your weapon's 'Martial Skill' twice between rests if it has any.

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you are wielding a weapon with the heavy property, that weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} of the damage type that the weapon normally deals.

optionalfeature.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see successfully attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to force that creature to reroll that attack using the lower of the two rolls. The new attack roll is now against your armor class instead of the target's. If that attack would still hit, you reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d6} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial melee weapon to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Protection
entries: You gain proficiency with shields if you do not already have it.
While you have a shield equipped, creatures within 5 ft of you also gain additional armor class equal to the bonus your shield provides you.
Whenever you take damage as a result of an attack roll or dexterity saving throw, you reduce that damage equal to the amount of armor class your shield provides you.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one maneuver of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain two superiority dice which are d4's (these dice are added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.

You can throw all other non-improvised melee weapons that do not have the heavy property as though they have the thrown weapon property. They have a base thrown range of 20/60. (reminder that you cannot throw weapons using their versatile dice even if you throw it with “two hands”)

Your thrown weapons normal range and long range is increased equal to your strength score rounded up to the nearest 5 feet. (for example: if you had a strength score of 13 you would increase the range of your thrown weapons by 15 feet.)
Your thrown daggers, deal a {@dice 1d6} as their damage dice in place of {@dice 1d4}.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting you gain the following benefits:

items: You may wield two weapons even if they do not have the light property, but they cannot have the heavy property or two-handed property.
You add all additional effects of the off-handed weapon not just the additional damage dice to rolls, however, you do not add additional flat modifiers to your attack roll.
You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

entries.name: Myriad of Attacks
