entries: The first time you miss with an attack on each of your turns, you may reroll {@dice 1d20} as a new attack roll. If you hit with the new attack roll, you only hit with one weapon (your choice) and only gain the effects and damage dice of that weapon. This attack roll cannot critically strike.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier on a hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield when you make the attack roll, the damage becomes {@damage 1d8}.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage to one creature {@condition grappled} by you.

optionalfeature.name: Bleed
entries: Once per short rest when you hit with an attack roll, you may attempt to cause the target to {@condition bleed|NICKED}. The creature must make a constitution saving throw vs a DC of [8 + (Str or Dex modifier) + your proficiency bonus].
Activate this effect only if you are proficient with the weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Bind to Mount
entries: Once per short rest, you may use an action to bind a creature who is caught by your net to a mount, vehicle, or other creature or object that is at least one size larger than it.
While bound by the net, the creature is dragged behind the object or creature it is bound to. It does not cost this creature or object extra movement to drag the creature in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Crack Shot
entries: Once per short rest, (no action required) you may make a single weapon attack at disadvantage. This attack cannot gain advantage from any sources.

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: Once per short rest, you may replace one attack to cleave with this weapon. You may attack up to three targets within 5 feet of each other instead of one.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Vault
entries: Once per short rest, you can tumble into and launch away from a creature. If you do push both creatures (you and your target) back 5ft. this tumble does not push creatures of a larger size than you, however you still are pushed back vaulting off the target by 5 ft.
If you were {@condition prone} you stand up (this movement does not trigger attacks of opportunity.)

optionalfeature.name: Concussive Smash
entries: Once per short rest, you may have an attack that you hit with become a concussive smash, a creature dealt damage by this attack must make a constitution saving throw vs a DC of [8 + (Str or Dex modifier) + your proficiency bonus] or become {@condition stunned} on a failure until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Strike
entries: Once per short rest, you may have an attack that you hit with become a crippling strike, a creature dealt damage by this attack must make a constitution saving throw vs a DC of [8 + (Str or Dex modifier) + your proficiency bonus] or have their move speed reduced to 15ft until the end of your next turn. An affected creature cannot gain any additional movement or take the dash action until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hamstring
entries: Once per short rest before you make a weapon attack, you can make that attack a hamstring shot. If that attack hits and deals damage, the creature must make a dexterity saving throw vs a DC of [8 + (Str or Dex modifier) + your proficiency bonus] or halve their move speed until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hit the Vein
entries: Once per long rest, when you hit with an attack, you may have that attack become a critical hit. This effect can only be used against humanoid and beast type monsters.

optionalfeature.name: Lead the Target
entries: Once per short rest, while you are {@condition prone}, you may spend an action to lead the target. If you do, until the end of your next turn you gain the following benefits:

items: +2 to hit with the weapon.
You have advantage on your attacks with this weapon.
Your attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6}. If you have another creature within 5 feet of you giving you the {@action help} action as a spotter, it deals an extra {@dice 2d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile Shot
entries: Once per short, after you take the {@action dash} or {@action disengage} action, you may use your bonus action to make one weapon attack with this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Overwhelm
entries: Once per short rest, when you take the {@action attack} action, you may attempt to overwhelm your foes. Until the start of your next turn, you may add your constitution modifier to damage for this weapon (minimum of +1, in addition to its regular bonuses)

optionalfeature.name: Point Blank
entries: Once per short rest whenever you make an attack at disadvantage as a result of being within 5 feet of a creature, you may instead attack at advantage with that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Pommel Strike
entries: Once per short rest whenever you make an attack at disadvantage as a result of being within 5 feet of a creature, you may instead attack at advantage with that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Rush Attack
entries: Once per short rest whenever you move at least 20 feet in a straight line towards a creature, you may make one weapon attack as part of that movement.

optionalfeature.name: Second Blade
entries: Once per short rest, when you attack with this weapon, you may make one additional attack as part of that attack action.

optionalfeature.name: Sunder Armor
entries: Once per short rest when you hit a creature and deal damage with that attack, you may reduce the armor of a target that has a natural, light, medium, or heavy armor by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus, until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Swords Dance
entries: Once per short rest as a bonus action, you may gain the benefits of the {@spell bless|NICKED} spell on yourself (without concentration) until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Topple
entries: Once per short rest when you hit a creature with this weapon, you may attempt to knock a creature {@condition prone}. They must make a strength saving throw vs a DC of [8 + (Str or Dex modifier) + your proficiency bonus] or become {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Unusual Guard
entries: Once per short rest when you are hit with an attack, you may use your reaction to gain a bonus to your armor class equal to your proficiency bonus possibly turning that attack into a miss.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Up
entries: Once per short rest, when you take the {@action attack} action, you must forgo all your extra attacks. You may double the ranges of your sling's ammunition. For each extra attack you forgo, gain an extra damage dice of the type your ammunition provides.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Hands (Aasimar)
entries: As an action you may heal a creature you touch causing it to recover a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Conqueror's Tools (Aasimar)
entries: You gain proficiency with a weapon of your choice. You gain one cantrip of your choice that requires a weapon as material cost. You may use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score as your spellcasting ability for these spells, choose which score you use when you gain this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Legacy (Aasimar)
entries: You know the {@spell light|NICKED} cantrip.
Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell lesser restoration|NICKED} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
You may use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score as your spellcasting ability for these spells, choose which score you use when you gain this feature.
You can also cast the {@spell lesser restoration|NICKED} spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Consumption (Aasimar)
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your bonus action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take radiant damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Born to Rule (Avian)
entries: You are part of the highborn. You learned the languages of many tribes and people to maintain relations with those who walk the land and swim the sea. Your post requires you to act as both leaders and ambassadors. You gain proficiency in two languages.

optionalfeature.name: Born to Serve (Avian)
entries: You are low born. Your roll is both important and subservient. Most of this caste are called wing splints as their wings are often damaged as an act of subjugation if the low born is obstinate or disobedient by the highborn. While not all those who are born to this caste harbor resentment to highborn many do and they often do their best to hide their offspring from the highborn as to prevent them from being damaged during their childhood. You gain proficiency in two tools as trade works of your employ or servitude.

optionalfeature.name: Born to Wander (Avian)
entries: Your people ran from the hierarchy or rejected outright on principal alone. Some just wished to wander and found peace among the nomads. Your people now wander the skies looking for suitable roosts and to stay away from the rigid structure of the sky-claves. Your people brough both the languages gained by the highborn and the tool working of the low born together in harmony with the land, as a result you gain proficiency in one tool and one language.

optionalfeature.name: Acid (Dragon Kin)
entries: You descend from emerald dragons or purple dragons gaining resistance to Acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Cold (Dragon Kin)
entries: You descend from white dragons or frost dragons gaining resistance to Cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fire (Dragon Kin)
entries: You descend from red dragons or dragon tyrants gaining resistance to Fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning (Dragon Kin)
entries: You descend from black dragons or dark blue dragons gaining resistance to Lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Poison (Dragon Kin)
entries: You descend from light green dragons or earth dragons gaining resistance to Poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Aereni (Elvenkind)
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill or tool. Double your proficiency bonus you add to that skill or tool.

optionalfeature.name: Eladrin (Elvenkind)
entries: You can speak Druidic and have at least one friendly relation with a druidic grove local to your home. You can cast the {@spell misty step|NICKED} spell once using this trait. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

You may use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score as your spellcasting ability for this spell, choose which score you use when you gain this feature. You can also cast the {@spell misty step|NICKED} spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

optionalfeature.name: Marked (Elvenkind)
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion|NICKED} cantrip.

Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|NICKED} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. You may use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score as your spellcasting ability for these spells, choose which score you use when you gain this feature.
You can also cast the {@spell invisibility|NICKED} spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

optionalfeature.name: Aid the Wish (Djinn)
entries: You know the {@spell guidance|NICKED} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

optionalfeature.name: To the Letter (Djinn)
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill investigation}.

optionalfeature.name: Twisted Wish (Djinn)
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill deception}.

optionalfeature.name: Crafter (Dwarf)
entries: You gain proficiency with a tool of your choice. Double your proficiency bonus to check made with that tool.

optionalfeature.name: Lore-Keeper (Dwarf)
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill history}. When attempting to recall the history of the dwarves, an item of legendary make, or stonework you double your proficiency bonus in this skill.

optionalfeature.name: Shield (Dwarf)
entries: You gain proficiency with two melee weapons of your choice and shields. You have advantage on all checks you make when trying to recall information about great battles in history or legendary warriors.

optionalfeature.name: Nomadic (Feline Kin)
entries: You gain proficiency with {@skill athletics} or {@skill acrobatics}, your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Sedentary (Feline Kin)
entries: You gain proficiency with {@skill animal handling} or {@skill stealth}, your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Sun (Fey)
entries: Those who align with the sun court gain the ability to cast {@spell enlarge/reduce|NICKED} starting at 3rd level. You may use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score as your spellcasting ability for this spell, choose which score you use when you gain this feature. You can also cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|NICKED} spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

optionalfeature.name: Moon (Fey)
entries: Those who align with the moon court gain the ability to cast {@spell crown of madness|NICKED} starting at 3rd level. You may use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score as your spellcasting ability for this spell, choose which score you use when you gain this feature. You can also cast the {@spell crown of madness|NICKED} spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

optionalfeature.name: Hermit (Gnome)
entries: You would prefer to be left alone. Your good at slipping away from others. You add a {@dice 1d4} to all {@skill stealth} rolls you make.

optionalfeature.name: Politician (Gnome)
entries: You have risen to the top of hierarchies through sheer lifespan in most cases. While you may never hold to top spot you are treated with respect. You have advantage on all charisma checks when talking to leaders, royals, and elders of kingdoms, tribes, or guilds.

optionalfeature.name: Tinkerer (Gnome)
entries: You have proficiency with tinker's tools. Double your proficiency bonus with those tools. Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.
When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

items.name: Clockwork Toy
entries: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

items.name: Fire Starter
entries: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

items.name: Music Box
entries: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

optionalfeature.name: Celestials (Gorgoniid)
entries: You can speak read and write celestial. You have advantage on survival checks to track them, as well as intelligence checks you make to recall information on them.

optionalfeature.name: Demons (Gorgoniid)
entries: You can speak read and write infernal. You have advantage on survival checks to track them, as well as intelligence checks you make to recall information on them.

optionalfeature.name: Dwarves (Halfling)
entries: You can speak, read, and write Dwarvish.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition and have resistance to any damage that would be dealt to you as a result of you eating, drinking, or ingesting something.

entries.name: Variant
entries: You may place all of your racial ability score increases into the same stat if you choose up to a maximum of 18 during character creation.

optionalfeature.name: Nomads (Halfling)
entries: Your base walking speed is increased to 35 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Northern Born (Human)
entries: You add {@dice 1d4} to all {@skill animal handling} or {@skill survival} rolls, choose one when you select this part of your race.

optionalfeature.name: Central Born (Human)
entries: You add a {@dice 1d4} to all {@skill insight} or {@skill perception} rolls, choose one when you select this part of your race.

optionalfeature.name: Central Born (Human)
entries: You add a {@dice 1d4} to all {@skill acrobatics} or {@skill athletics} checks, choose one when you select this part of your race.

optionalfeature.name: Stars (Mythfolk)
entries: You gain proficiency with navigator's tools.

optionalfeature.name: Song (Mythfolk)
entries: You gain proficiency with one instrument of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Satiation (Mythfolk)
entries: You gain proficiency in cook's tools or brewer's supplies (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Beast Blood (Orcish)
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Foe Blood (Orcish)
entries: You have advantage on death saving throws. You add your proficiency bonus to those saves.

optionalfeature.name: Orc Blood (Orcish)
entries: You may use your relentless endurance feature once per short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Embraced (Tiefling)
entries: You gain the {@spell thaumaturgy|NICKED} cantrip. It shares the same spellcasting stat as your infernal legacy.

optionalfeature.name: Neutral (Tiefling)
entries: You gain the {@spell mage hand|NICKED} cantrip. It shares the same spellcasting stat as your infernal legacy. The hand you make with this trait is {@condition invisible}.

optionalfeature.name: Hated (Tiefling)
entries: You roll a {@dice 1d4} and add it to all {@skill survival} rolls you make.

monster.name: Bone Familiar
languages: Understands the languages you speak, cannot speak (however it can rattle and click with its joints)

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Bone familiar is immune to the effects of turn undead and is immune to the effects of destroy undead.

trait.name: Flyby (Bone Bird)
entries: This creature does not take opportunity attacks as a result of leaving a creatures weapons reach without taking the {@action disengage} action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude (Bone Sentinel, Bone Beast)
entries: Your Companion has advantage on any ability check that relies on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Wield Weapon (Bone Sentinel)
entries: The bone sentinel may wield a weapon that you give it (or two weapons if they have the light property). It is considered proficient with them

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bone familiar makes a number of attacks based on your level. One at cleric levels 1-7. Two at cleric levels 8-13. Three at 14th level cleric and higher.

action.name: Peck or Claw (Bone Bird)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4} + your wisdom modifier piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Force-Empowered Slam (Bone Beast, Bone Sentinel(no weapon))
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10} + your wisdom modifier bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Weapon: (Bone Sentinel(weapon))
entries: The Bone sentinel makes a weapon attack with the weapon it is holding and uses your wisdom modifier for attack rolls and damage

action.name: Feral Movement (Bone Beast)
entries: The Bone Beast can {@action dash} or {@action disengage} as a bonus action.

monster.name: Fungal Zombie
languages: Understands all languages you do but cannot speak

trait.name: Controller
entries: The creature that created this creature is using its fungal infestation ability.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: This creature can respond to your mental commands at a range of 1,000 ft.

Additionally all zombies raised by fungal infestation share the same collective hivemind and are treated as one collective “familiar”. It does not communicate back to its controller through this link in any way.
Its controller is made aware when the creature dies.

trait.name: Hive Resilience
entries: The first time this creature is reduced to 0 hp from a source other than radiant damage or from a critical hit it drops to 1 hp instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6} + PB psychic damage.

action.name: Spore Burst.
entries: The zombie detonates into a puff of spores, all creatures other than its controller within 5ft suffer the damage from the controller's symbiotic entity effect making the save vs the controllers spell save dc. Then if the damage rolled is greater than current temporary hp of the controller, the controller gains temporary hp equal to the damage rolled as though it was from the effect of symbiotic entity.
After using this effect, the zombie is destroyed, and the corpse is reduced to bones and cannot be raised again using fungal infestation.
This effect ignores hive resilience.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: This creature is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Flame Seed
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 60 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Teleportation
entries: The spirit and each willing creature of your choice within 5 feet of it teleport up to 15 feet to unoccupied spaces you can see. Then each creature within 5 feet of the space that the spirit left must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 1d6 + PB} fire damage.

monster.name: Chained Shadow
languages: Understands the languages you do, but cannot speak

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks except for perception, and saving throws.
If the creature is within 5 ft of you, it has advantage on {@skill stealth} checks instead of disadvantage if it can {@action hide} in your shadow.

trait.name: Creature of Shadow
entries: The creature functions as a shadow for the sake of all abilities and spells, and is destroyed by effects that do not allow the existence of shadows.
For example: The {@spell daylight|NICKED} spell destroys the spirit when it is initially cast.

action.name: Shadow Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h 9}{@damage 2d6 + 2} necrotic damage.

monster.actionNote: You may have the creature actually be your shadow: when you summon the creature your shadow detaches and becomes the creature, when in bright light you cast no shadow. Talk to your DM if you wish this to be the case as it may have mechanical effects both positive and negative.

ac.special: 13 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: Speed
entries: 30 ft. (Scorpion only) / 10ft. & fly 40 ft. (Wasp only)/ 40ft., climb 20ft (Centipede only) / climb 30ft., 30ft (Spider only)

trait.name: Wall Climb (Centipede, Spider only)
entries: The Giant Insect can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Paralytic Sting (Scorpion, Wasp only)
entries: The Giant Insect can attempt to paralyze a creature hit with its sting attack. The creature must make a constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for one minute. The creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of their turns to end the condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Giant Insect makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Bite (Centipede, Spider only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + summonSpellLevel} piercing damage.

On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} poison (acid, centipede only) damage, half as much on a success. If the poison (acid, centipede only) damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Claw (Scorpion only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} slashing damage.

action.name: Sting (Scorpion, Wasp only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + summonSpellLevel} piercing damage and {@damage 1d6} poison damage.
On hit, you may trigger paralytic sting.

action.name: Web (Spider only) (Recharges after 1 minute)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hitpoints 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

condition.name: Reeling
entries: The next attack roll against the creature gains an additional chance to hit and cannot critically miss (rolls of a 1 do not automatically miss).
The additional chance to hit comes in the form of the largest damage dice that caused the creature to become reeling. This effect ends on the creature after:

items: The {@action help} action is used to steady them.
It uses its action to end the condition.
An attack is made against it.

entries: (For example: A creature is hit with a greataxe and suffers the reeling condition. A great axe's largest damage dice that was used as part of the damage is a 1d12. The next attack roll against that creature then rolls a 1d20 and a 1d12, and adds them together with all other relevant modifiers to see if the attack hits).

condition.name: Bleed
entries: A creature takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage at the start of their turn.
This effect lasts until the creature takes an action to stem the bleeding, is healed for at least 1 hitpoint, is stabilized by a spell or ability, or 1 minute passes.

feat.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: You increase one ability by 2, or two abilities by 1, to a maximum of 20.

feat.name: Actor
entries: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in your choice of {@skill deception} or {@skill performance}
You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

entries.name: Insightful Magic
entries: You learn one 2nd level spell of your choice. The 2nd level spell must be from the illusion or transmutation school of magic. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the same as your spellcasting ability of the class which takes this feat.

entries.name: Balance Fate
entries: When you make an attack roll or an ability check as part of a spell and roll a 9 or lower on the d20, you can balance fate and treat the roll as a 10.
You can balance fate in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Agent of Order
entries: You gain a magical tattoo, incantation, or other cosmic manifestations that you use to channel cosmic forces of order to gain these benefits:

items: Stasis Strike: Once per turn, when you damage a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself, you can deal an extra 1d8 force damage to the target, and it must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier increased by Agent of Order's first ability) as spectral bindings try to ensnare it. On a successful save, the target escapes. On a failed save, the target has the restrained condition until the start of your next turn. These bindings manifest as chains or some other symbol of stasis.

entries: You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Alert
entries: Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain +5 bonus to initiative
You can't be surprised while you are conscious.
Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

feat.name: All In
entries: Before you make an attack roll, you may give yourself a negative bonus to hit to garner more damage on an attack. This damage and negative modifier are based on the chart below.

Whenever you critically strike on an attack roll against a creature, that creature gains the {@condition reeling|NICKED} condition until the end of your next turn. (This effect only applies if the attack dealt damage to the creature.)

items: You gain proficiency with {@item tinker's tools}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.

You can replicate a magic item from the chart below whenever you finish a long rest. This item remains functional until you replicate another item with this feature or die, in which the item remains magical until a number of days have passed equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). The type of item is based on what level your character is. If a replicated item is a container, it expels its contents harmlessly nearby whenever the infusion ends.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

items: When you are {@condition prone}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.
You can make a running long jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather that 10 feet.
When you take the {@action dash} action, you gain an additional 10 feet of jump distance and 5 feet of jump height.

feat.name: Cartomancer
entries: You have learned to channel your magic through a deck of cards {@item playing card set}. You can use a card deck as your spellcasting focus, and you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Card Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the item {@item playing card set}

items.name: Card Tricks
entries: You learn {@spell prestidigitation|NICKED} and can use it to create illusions that duplicate the effects of stage magic. When you use {@spell prestidigitation|NICKED} in this way, you can conceal the verbal and somatic components of the spell as ordinary conversation and card handling.

items.name: Hidden Ace
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can choose one spell from your class's spell list and imbue that spell into a card. The chosen spell must have a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action, and it must be a level for which you have spell slots. The card remains imbued with this spell until your next long rest. While the card is imbued with the spell, you can use a bonus action to flourish the card and cast the spell within. The card then immediately loses its magic.

items.name: Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill athletics}

items.name: Aggressive Assault
entries: Whenever you take the {@action dash} action and you move at least 10 feet in a straight line, you may make one melee weapon or unarmed strike attack as part of that action.

items.name: Ability Assault
entries: If you replace your attack granted by your Aggressive Assault with an ability check, you gain a +5 to that ability check.

feat.name: Chef
entries: Time spent mastering the culinary arts as paid off, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Bolstering Food
entries: As part of a long rest, you can cook special food provided you have ingredients and {@item cook's utensils} on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your proficiency bonus. At the end of the long rest, any creature who eats the food gains additional max hitpoints that last until their next long rest. The amount of max hitpoints each creature gains is equal to your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier bonus that chef granted as part of taking this feat.

items.name: Snack
entries: Once per long rest and with one hour of work provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand, you may prepare a number of treats that give a small benefit to any creature that eats it. Creatures can eat this treat as a bonus action, and its effects last for one hour. When you prepare these treats select an effect from the table below:

rows: Creature has a +2 to all {@skill persuasion} and {@skill deception} checks
The creature gains a +2 to all Initiative and {@skill intimidation} rolls and checks.
The creature gains +2 to all tool checks.
The creature gains advantage on all {@skill perception} checks they use to detect traps. They have a +2 to all {@skill history} checks to recall information.
The next time the creature would take damage reduce that damage by {@dice 2d6} to a minimum of 0.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You are practiced in the art of crushing your enemies, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that does bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided that target is no more than one size larger than you.
When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.
You may now use your bludgeoning weapon's Martial Skill an additional time between rests.

feat.name: Divinely Favored
entries: A god chose you to carry a spark of their power.

You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=Cleric N (NICKED)|source=NICKED} and one 1st level spell based on the alignment of the divine source of your power as specified in the Alignment Spells table below. You also learn {@spell augury|NICKED}

You can cast that chosen 1st level spell and {@spell augury|NICKED} without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the  appropriate level.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).
In addition, you can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses the spellcasting ability you chose when you selected this feat.

feat.name: Dread-bringer
entries: When angered, you radiate menace. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Abandon Hope
entries: As an action you can produce a savage cry, creeping aura, or some other force to bring creatures around you to their knees. You force each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier increased by Dread-bringer's first ability). A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. If the frightened target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. You may use this ability once per short rest.

feat.name: Dragon Hide
entries: You manifest scales and claws reminiscent of dragons. You gain the following benefits.

items: Your body gains hardened scales. You minimum armor class is 13 + you Dexterity modifier. If you're wearing a shield, you may still add its armor class to your minimum armor class.

You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claw requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes for {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

feat.name: Dungeon Delver
entries: Alert to the hidden traps and secret doors found in many dungeons, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps
You have resistance to damage dealt by traps.
Traveling at a fastest pace doesn't impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Wisdom ({@skill perception}) score.
You have advantage on all history checks to recall information about a specific dungeon or piece of lore about that dungeon.

feat.name: Durable
entries: HARDY, RESILIENT, TOUGH, you are the pinnacle of hard to kill gain the following benefits:

items: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.
When you finish a short rest, you regain all of your missing hit points.

Once per long rest when you are hit by a critical hit from an attack that you can see, you can use your reaction to turn that hit into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
entries: (Repeatable)

When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Each time you take this feat again, you must select a different damage type. You gain the following features for spells that deal damage of the chosen type.

items: Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type.

When you cast a leveled spell that deals damage of the chosen type, that spell deals extra damage equal to the spell level of the spell cast in this way. You only gain the damage on this spell the first time this spell deals damage when cast.

feat.name: Ember of the Fire Soul
entries: You've manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, red dragons, or flame elementals, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Flame
entries: You have resistance to Fire damage.

items.name: Searing Ignition
entries: When you take the {@action attack} action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to {@damage 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, and it has the {@condition blinded} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.
You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus (but no more than once per turn), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Fade Away
entries: You are clever, with a knack for illusion magic and covering yourself in nature's veil. You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits:

items: Immediately after you take damage, you can use a reaction to magically become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Fey Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Fey's wild magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell misty step|NICKED} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the divination or enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Fighting Style
entries: When you gain this feat, you gain one of the following fighting styles listed below. If you take this feat again for any reason, you cannot gain the same fighting style more than once. If you would be forced to take a specific fighting style you already know, you may take another despite any class's, subclasses, or ability feature's restrictions.

feat.name: Fury of the Frost Soul
entries: You've manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, ice devils, and frost elementals granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Ice
entries: You have resistance to Cold damage.

items.name: Frigid Retaliation
entries: Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} + your proficiency bonus cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Chromatic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

entries.name: Chromatic Infusion
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Reactive Resistance
entries: When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Gem Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of gem dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Telekinetic Reprisal
entries: When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Draconic Healing
entries: You learn the {@spell cure wounds|NICKED} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have. The spell's spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma when you cast it with this feat (choose when you gain the feat).

items.name: Protective Wings
entries: You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Grappler
entries: You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 to Strength, to a maximum of 20.
You may attempt to grapple a creature as a bonus action.

Moving with a creature that you have {@condition grappled} or are carrying, that is your size or smaller, does not cost extra movement. This only applies if you have only one creature {@condition grappled} or carried and they do not have this feat. (this effect also applies if you are grappling, carrying, dragging or pulling an ally)(Additionally if they have this feat but allow you to grapple them it costs no additional movement)

You can use your action to try to pin a creature {@condition grappled} by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, you and the creature are both {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: You've learned to put the weight of a weapon to your advantage. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action attack} action and attack with heavy melee weapon, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the hilt of the weapon; this attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary attack. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage.
When you hit with a heavy ranged weapon, you may push that creature up to 5 feet away from you in a straight line.
If you have advantage on the attack roll you make with a heavy weapon, you double the damage you add from your ability modifier.

feat.name: Guile of the Cloud Soul
entries: You've manifested the confounding magic emblematic of cloud giants, wind serpents, and air elementals, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cloudy Escape
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that attack's damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Healer
entries: You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@skill medicine} skill.
When you use a {@item healer's kit|phb} to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

As an action, you can spend one use of a {@item healer's kit|phb} to tend to a creature and restore X number of {@dice 1d6 } + 4 hit points to it where X is the creature's level or CR. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

feat.name: Heavily Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Bulwark
entries: While you are wearing heavy armor, you may gain temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Infernal Constitution
entries: Fiendish blood runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some fiends. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to poison damage.
You have resistance to fire or cold damage (your choice).
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

feat.name: Inspiring Leader
entries: You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest.

feat.name: Keen Mind
entries: You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain one tool proficiency.
You always know which way is north.
You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.
Once per long rest when you roll a d20 for a skill or tool that requires intelligence to use, you may reroll one of the d20 used in the roll taking the higher of the two rolls.

feat.name: Keenness of the Stone Soul
entries: You've manifested the physical talents emblematic of stone giants, and earth elementals granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cavernous Sight
entries: You gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from another source, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Stone Throw
entries: As a bonus action, you can take a rock and make a magical attack with it. The attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet that uses the ability score you increased with this feat as the spellcasting ability.

On a hit, the rock deals {@damage 1d10} force damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the spellcasting ability modifier) or become {@condition prone}.
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Lightly Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of light armor, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with light armor.

feat.name: Linguist
entries: You have studied languages and codes, and can rapidly assimilate languages, gaining the following benefits:

items: You immediately learn three languages of your choice. Then, you gain the ability to rapidly assimilate other creatures' languages; you learn speech patterns. You can spend one hour conversing with a creature who speaks a language you do not know and learn the basics but not enough to have a complex conversation. If the creature is attempting to purposefully teach you, you become fluent with the language.

You can ably create written ciphers. Others can't decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it.

feat.name: Lucky
entries: You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment.

You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional {@dice d20}. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the {@dice d20}s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or yours. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.
You regain your expended luck points when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Mage Slayer
entries: You have practiced techniques useful in melee combat against spellcasters, gaining the following benefits:

items: Whenever a creature uses a spell or magical ability to teleport, blink, cross planes, or traverse distance while within 5 feet of you, you may discern the location of where the creature is attempting to leave to as an {@skill arcana} check (no action required), and gain some basic information about the locale.

items.name: Kick
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you begins to cast a spell that you can see, You can use your reaction to attempt to interrupt that creature in the process of casting that spell. The creature must make a constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

items: When you damage a creature that is {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its {@status concentration}.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of you.
If you are within 5 feet of a spellcaster and they cast a spell that would force another creature to make a saving throw, that creature makes that saving throw with advantage.

feat.name: Magic Initiate
entries: Choose a class: {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1|class=Bard N (NICKED)}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric N (NICKED)}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid N (NICKED)}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=Sorcerer N (NICKED)}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=Warlock N (NICKED)}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard N (NICKED)}. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list.

In addition, choose one 1st-level spell to learn from that same list. Using this feat, you can cast the spell once at its lowest level, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again.

Your spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the class you chose: Charisma for {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1|class=Bard N (NICKED)}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=Sorcerer N (NICKED)}, or {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=Warlock N (NICKED)}; Wisdom for {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric N (NICKED)} or {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid N (NICKED)}; or Intelligence for {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard N (NICKED)}.

feat.name: Medium Armor Master
entries: You ignore the equip weight of medium armor.

entries.name: Aegis
entries: While you are wearing medium armor, you Ignore the additional damage critical hits would deal to you. You are still subject to non-damage-based effects.

feat.name: Metamagic Adept
entries: You've learned how to exert your will on your spells to alter how they function:

items: You learn two {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=S:MM} options of your choice from the sorcerer class.
You gain 2 additional sorcery points.

feat.name: Mobile
entries: You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your speed increases by 10 feet.
When you use the {@action Dash} action, {@quickref difficult terrain||3} doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.
When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

feat.name: Moderately Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of medium armor and shields, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with medium armor and shields.

feat.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: You are a dangerous foe to face while mounted. While you are mounted and aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 to your constitution score, up to a maximum of 20.
You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount.
You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.

If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.
Mounting or Dismounting a creature only costs you 5 feet of movement.

feat.name: Observant
entries: Quick to notice details of your environment, you gain the following benefits:

items: If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips.
You have a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and passive Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) scores.

feat.name: Enduring Fury
entries: Your fury burns tirelessly. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Enduring Fury
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

feat.name: Outlands Envoy
entries: You have spent significant time in Sigil or the Outlands, the crossroads of the multiverse. Being steeped in converging planar energies grants you these benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@skill survival}.

items.name: Crossroads Emissary
entries: You learn the {@spell misty step|NICKED} and {@spell tongues|NICKED} spells. You can cast each spell once using this feat without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast that spell in this way again. When you cast {@spell tongues|NICKED} using this feat, you require no material components. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the Scion of the Outer Planes feat.

feat.name: Parry
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add twice your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

When you parry and the attack misses, the creature is sent {@condition Reeling|NICKED}. The dice used for {@condition Reeling|NICKED} is one of the damage dice of the melee weapon you used to parry this attack.

feat.name: Piercer
entries: You have achieved a penetrating precision in combat, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.
When you score a critical hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.
You may now use of your piercing weapon's 'Martial Skill' an additional time between rests.

feat.name: Planar Wanderer
entries: You can draw on the forces of the multiverse to survive cosmic extremes and to traverse its infinite realms, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Planar Adaptation
entries: When you finish a long rest, you gain resistance to either acid, cold, or fire damage (your choice) until you finish your next long rest.

items.name: Portal Cracker
entries: Your experience with portals allows you to open them without a portal key. As an action, you can concentrate on a portal you're aware of that is within 5 feet of yourself and make a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. On a failed check, you take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and can't use this benefit on that portal again until you finish a long rest. On a successful check, you can force the portal open or closed for 1 hour. For that duration, the portal doesn't respond to its portal key unless a creature employing the key succeeds on a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check as an action.

items.name: Portal Sense
entries: You know the direction to the last planar portal you used while you and the portal are on the same plane of existence. Moreover, as an action, you can detect the location of any portals within 30 feet of you that aren't behind total cover. Once you detect a portal with this action, you can't use the action again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Poisoner
entries: You can prepare and deliver deadly poisons, granting you the following benefits:

items: You Gain +1 to Dexterity or Intelligence, to a maximum of 20.
When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores resistance to poison damage.
You can apply poison to a weapon or piece of ammunition as a bonus action, instead of an action.
You gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|phb} if you don't already have it.
With one hour of work using a {@item poisoner's kit|phb} and expending 50 gp worth of materials, you can create a number of doses of 'Potent Poison' equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Potent Poison
entries: This poison retains its potency on a piece of ammunition or weapon for 1 minute. This poison deals {@damage 1d8} poison damage on a successful hit. Then the creature must make a Constitution saving throw based on the ability improved by this feat. On a failure the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn. After a successful hit, the poison is consumed.
After a successful hit the poison is consumed.

feat.name: Resilient

choose.entry: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: (Repeatable)
Choose one ability score. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in saving throws using the chosen ability.

feat.name: Revenant Blade

feature: Dueling or Dyad Handed Fighting Style

entries: You have learned some techniques that allow you to press your body and skills to their utmost.

items: You can press your advantage in even the slightest openings. Whenever you make an opportunity attack you double your ability modifier for that attack. (both the attack roll and damage)

feat.name: Righteous Heritor
entries: You can channel cosmic forces of good to gain these benefits:

items.name: Soothe Pain
entries: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Ritual Caster
entries: You have learned a number of spells that you can cast as rituals. These spells are written in a ritual book, which you must have in hand while casting one of them.

When you choose this feat, you acquire a ritual book holding two 1st-level spells of your choice. Choose one of the following classes: {@filter bard|spells|level=1|class=Bard N (NICKED)|components & miscellaneous=ritual}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=1|class=Cleric N (NICKED)|components & miscellaneous=ritual}, {@filter druid|spells|level=1|class=Druid N (NICKED)|components & miscellaneous=ritual}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=1|class=Sorcerer N (NICKED)|components & miscellaneous=ritual}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=1|class=Warlock N (NICKED)|components & miscellaneous=ritual}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=1|class=Wizard N (NICKED)|components & miscellaneous=ritual}. You must choose your spells from that class's spell list, and the spells you choose must have the ritual tag. The class you choose also determines your spellcasting ability for these spells: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

If you come across a spell in written form, such as a magical {@item spell scroll} or a wizard's spellbook, you might be able to add it to your ritual book. The spell must be on the spell list for the class you chose, the spell's level can be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: When you need to throw caution to the winds or are put into a bad situation its time to act like a cornered wolf, and you have learned how to act as such.

items: Whenever you have disadvantage on attack rolls with a {@bold melee} weapon you are proficient with, you gain an additional chance to hit, after you roll the attack roll you may add {@dice 1d6} to the roll.

Whenever you have advantage on an attack with a {@bold melee} weapon you are proficient with and hit with that attack, you may force the creature to make a constitution saving throw. The DC for this ability equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity. Upon a failure the creature gains the {@condition reeling|NICKED} condition.

feat.name: Sentinel
entries: You have mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard, gaining the following benefits:

items: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the {@action Disengage} action before leaving your reach.
When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack and they did not take the {@action disengage} action, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

When a creature within reach of your {@bold melee} weapon makes an attack against a target other than you (and that target doesn't have this feat), you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature. This attack counts as an attack of opportunity for all abilities and features.

feat.name: Shadow Touched
entries: Your exposure to a Shade's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell invisibility|NICKED} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N|source=NICKED} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N|source=NICKED} must be from the illusion or necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Thanks to extensive practice with ranged weapons, you gain the following benefits:

items: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
Creatures being prone within your weapons normal range does not impose disadvantage.

feat.name: Shield Master
entries: You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a {@item shield|phb}:

items: Your shield now counts as a weapon when you attack, it deals {@damage 1d4} + your strength as bludgeoning damage. It has the thrown property with a range of 20/40.
You can equip a shield with the same speed you could draw a weapon.
If you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.
You may {@action shove} a creature as a bonus action using your shield.

entries: Restrictions:

items: You cannot use the dueling fighting style.
You cannot use the two weapon fighting style.
Your shield counts only as armor or a weapon (your choice) not both at the same time for the purposes of spells or abilities.
Reminder-If you equip multiple shields, you only benefit from the armor of one of them.

feat.name: Skill Expert
entries: You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in one {@table skills|phb|skill} of your choice.

Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@table skills|phb} or {@filter tools|items|type=tools;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set;vehicle (land);vehicle (water)} of your choice.

feat.name: Skirmisher
entries: You are expert at slinking through shadows. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.

When you roll initiative, you gain a special action at the start of each combat. Before any other creature who does not have this feat takes a turn in combat, you may move up to their speed make one weapon attack. If you are hidden, this attack does not reveal your position even if the attack hits. If multiple creatures have this feat, roll a 1d20 to determine which of those creatures makes an attack first (highest wins). If those creatures are friendly and can communicate with voice or hand signals, they may choose the order in which they make their attacks.

feat.name: Slasher
entries: You've learned where to cut to have the greatest results, granting you the following benefits:

items: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.
You may now use of your slashing weapon's 'Martial Skill' an additional time between rests.

feat.name: Soul of the Storm Herald
entries: You've manifested the tempest magic emblematic of storm giants, storm crows, and lightning elementals granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Maelstrom Aura
entries: As a bonus action, you surround yourself with an aura of magical wind and lightning that extends 10 feet from you in every direction but not through total cover. The aura lasts until the start of your next turn or until you are {@condition incapacitated}. While the aura is active, you have resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and whenever another creature starts its turn within the aura, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn.
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll or if a {@bold cantrip} would force a creature to make a saving throw, the spell's range is doubled.
Your ranged spell attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

You learn one cantrip that requires an attack roll or saving throw. Choose the cantrip from the {@filter bard|spells|level=0|class=Bard N (NICKED)|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0|class=Cleric N (NICKED)|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0|class=Druid N (NICKED)|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer N (NICKED)|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0|class=Warlock N (NICKED)|spell attack=m;r;o}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0|class=Wizard N (NICKED)|spell attack=m;r;o} spell list. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip depends on the spell list you chose from: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with improvised weapons.
Your unarmed strike uses a {@damage 1d4} for damage.
When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

feat.name: Telekinetic
entries: You learn to move things with your mind, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell mage hand|NICKED} cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition invisible}. If you already know this spell, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it. Its spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

As a bonus action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

feat.name: Telepathic
entries: You awaken the ability to mentally connect with others, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

You can cast the {@spell detect thoughts|NICKED} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

feat.name: Titan Grip
entries: You may wield two-handed melee weapons in one hand as though it did not have the heavy property
You may use heavy weapons while two weapon fighting.
You do not need to two hand versatile weapons to use their higher damage dice.

feat.name: Unerring Accuracy
entries: Your accuracy is legendary, especially when you garner a moment of advantage. You have uncanny aim with attacks that rely on precision rather than brute force. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you have advantage on an attack roll that does not use your strength modifier to make an attack, you can reroll the lower of the two dice once.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your {@status concentration} on a spell when you take damage.
You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a {@item shield|phb} in one or both hands.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a single weapon; select a weapon you are proficient with and gain the following features:

items: You expand your chances to critically strike critting on a 19 and 20. If you have another feature that expands your critical range, expand that range by one number lower.
When you critically strike a creature, you may recover one of the uses of the weapon's 'Martial Skill'

feat.name: Wild Hunter's Magic
entries: You learn the magic of the primeval woods. You learn one druid cantrip of your choice.
You also learn the {@spell longstrider|NICKED} spell and can cast it at will.
{@spell pass without trace|NICKED} spell which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Zenith of Physical Form
entries: You increase one Ability score by 2. This can exceed 20 and increases your cap for that ability score by 2

entries.name: Aquatic
entries: This weapon does not have disadvantage on attacks while being used underwater.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Finesse
entries: This melee weapon can be used with Rogue Sneak Attack.

entries.name: Heavy
entries: This weapon requires at least 15 strength to wield effectively.
A creature without at least 15 strength that attempts to make an attack with this weapon cannot benefit from any advantage and rolls the attack roll with disadvantage.

entries.name: Light
entries: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

entries.name: Loading
entries: If your character does not have proficiency with this weapon, it takes an action to reload it. Otherwise, you may draw and load a piece of ammunition as part of an attack.

entries.name: Complex Loading
entries: If your character does not have proficiency with this weapon, or does not have an intelligence score of at least 13, it takes an action to reload this weapon. Otherwise, you may draw and load a piece of ammunition as part of an attack.

entries.name: Range
entries: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers.
